Reviews.Title: “Location AND Service”
Reviews.Author: bttampa1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our first three nights in Spain here, and then began a tour of the south, returning ten days later for our last three nights...WOW! Can not recommend highly enough. Absolute superb location, and the staff went out of their way to make our time perfect. Here are the negatives: Wi-Fi is sketchy in upper floors - sometimes worked, sometimes didn't, but always worked perfectly in lobby (where comfortable chairs made e-mailing nice); alright, that's all I can think of....what a great place! an easy stroll to Plaza Mayor and Plaza Santa Ana, breakfast at La Mallorquina about 1 minute away, waking up and opening the French balcony windows to look down on Madrid beginning to bustle below us....yep, if we make it back to madrid we'll definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location,location, location”
Reviews.Author: Norman S
Reviews.Content: This is my fourth stay at hotel europa and it was perfect as always. It's location on the peurta del sol cannot be beaten. While the hotel has been renovated and modernized ore the years, it has not complete lost its charm. The staff are friendly and helpful and the rooms and common areas are always spotless. While a little pricier, I would recommend the rooms overlooking the square. The windows are very soundproof so the noise is not a problem. I would stay there again and have often recommended it to friends and colleagues. Norm from Canada

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: DublinBathy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights - based on the fact the prices were reasonable for Madrid and the location recommended. The location proved excellent - a busy area right in the centre of the city, easy for reaching most main attractions and tapas bars and for when you are too tired to walk beside a big metro station. The hotel is very nice inside and the hotel staff very polite. We liked our room - it was smallish but fine. The bathroom was a good size and really nicely tiled, with fresh bath products daily. The only minor thing was the room got a bit stuffy and although there was air conditioning it appeared to be broken. As the weather got cooler when we were there this didnt matter too much. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Mshenson
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after staying in apartments around Spain. Although, imprefer doing this, it was a great change of pace to have a friendly staff greet us and give us excellent recommendations to local activities and restaurants. Rooms were great. It was right off the main plaza, but we never worried about noise. This place was an amazing deal that shouldn't be passed up!

Reviews.Title: “Spotless, fabulous Location and views - Beware of the noise”
Reviews.Author: kbaerliny
Reviews.Content: Previous reviewers led us to this wonderful hotel directly on the Puerto del Sol. We had a terrific room on floor 3 with 2 baclonies overlooking the always active square. The room was spotless and the staff were friendly and efficient. The shower was strong and bedding comfortable, the two things I always consider in my rating of a hotel since a good night's sleep is kinda critical. Despite the high quality windows, there is no way to avoid the noise from the activities below but that's payback for the best location in Madrid. If you go, don't miss an opportunity for some tapas and a glass of wine at the Mercado de San Miguel which is about a 10 minute stroll from the front door of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: SheriEllenG
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Madrid, first lasting only one night. We were pleasantly greeted by the staff and while the outside may look questionable the inside is perfect. Rooms are standard size for Europe, small but clean.Location could not be better but be prepared for some late night noise as you are in the center of a very busy area.Situated in a perfect location easily accessible by walking to many historic sites and the metro and short walking distance from the bus stop. Staff were very pleasant and knowledgeable. Would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to be in the center of activity and a good affordable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very conveniently sited, friendly staff (more than happy to look after our bags for us)”
Reviews.Author: SamOldfield
Reviews.Content: We don't usually go for big hotels but this suited us fine - and we had a great view over the square

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel; Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraK10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location for sight seeing. It is right on Puerta del Sol and there is a metro stop just steps away. The staff was very nice and helpful during our stay. The rooms were a decent size and very clean. The bathrooms were nice as well (good water pressure in the shower). There is also a restaurant run by the hotel that has a nice outdoor patio, which was great for a glass of wine, tapas, and some good people watching. Definitely ask for a room towards the top floors as it can get noisy in the Puerta del Sol.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: John m
Reviews.Content: Very good value hotel. Perfect location. Clean and quiet. Felt safe and secure. Free internet in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice in the Heart of the City”
Reviews.Author: Charlie_From_Ohio
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Europa at the beginning and the end of this most recent trip to Spain. It was an easy choice since I had stayed there before. The location is perfect and an easy walk to major tourist attractions. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The price is a good value. Note that the Puerta del Sol is a hub of activity well into the night. I requested a "quiet" room facing the interior and recommend this to anyone bothered by nightlife outside.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, nice rooms, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ssberger
Reviews.Content: I know how stressful it is to pick a hotel, I spent hours researching! But believe me, look no further, this is a great place to stay. Nice, clean, lots of light, best location, friendly staff, all you want for your Madrid vacation is right here. We stayed in a quadruple, my husband, I and two teenagers, and we have plenty of space. I would stay here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Well run, centrally located, quiet”
Reviews.Author: MarionHBerkeley
Reviews.Content: We weren't sure about staying right on the Plaza Del Sol, but this hotel was surprisingly quiet, and it was really fun being so close to shopping and Tapas. As soon as we arrived, they had a bellman wisk away our luggage, and we were efficiently checked in with keys and wi-fi in mere moments. The cafe downstairs was fabulous. I would love to encapsulate the whole experience and bring it home with me. The rooms were clean, comfortable, and modern. Our room did not overlook the street, so I can't vouch for the experience looking over the plaza. Probably not as quiet, but what a scene!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: nlitli
Reviews.Content: This has to be one of the best hotels in Madrid, not only location, but hotel staff is professional, courteous and take security very serious. Rooms and bathrooms are spacious and spotlessly clean. Everything is within a three-block radius, El Corte Ingles which is a one stop store, Plaza Mayor, Gran Via, Royal Palace, restaurants, theaters.etc. Public transportation is excellent in Madrid. Have stayed at different hotels but always come back to Hotel Europa.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient - in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: JaniceR999
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice. Clean, updated and surprisingly roomy. The cafe that's attached is perfect for breakfast or evening espresso. We could walk to the Prado, shopping, great restaurants from the hotel. But be aware that the plaza will be crowded and noisy pretty much all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: JoePacific
Reviews.Content: This hotel has reasonably good sized rooms, is modern and clean, and has a supportive, helpful and friendly staff. The location in Madrid is perfect for getting around. The hotel is in the middle of a shopping area and Madrid gathering place. Subway and taxi are also extremely convenient. We loved this hotel and highly recommend it for anyone considering a holiday in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “The best New Year's Eve Part II”
Reviews.Author: elyrivera
Reviews.Content: As in December 2010, we flew to Spain for Christmas vacations on December 27 from de. After few days in La Coruna, in the northwest part of Spain, we arrived in Madrid for the New Year's Eve and stayed again in Hotel Europa (we stayed from December 28, 2011 to January 3, 2012). This hotel is the best one if you decide to celebrate in Puerta del Sol Square. Most of the rooms are just in front of this place so you and your family or friends can spend the night in the balcony of your room looking the TV (the celebration is transmitted by TVE1, one of the television channel in Spain) and the crowded people in the Square. Really it is very excited! The room, as usual, very clean. The Staff are excellent, specially Raul, Javier and the other personnel who attend the Front Desk. The hotel has Wifi and two computers in the Lobby, available for customers free of charge. As always be aware that the room rate rises considerably from December 29, 30 and 31. In addition, the security box should be requested and the charge is approximately 2 euros per day. This hotel is centrally located so you have a lot of shops, restaurants and cafeterias around. The hotel has his own Restaurant-Cafeteria which opens very early in the morning and offers breakfast, lunch and dinner and also room service to the customers. Just in front of the hotel you have the Sol Metro Station, which is very useful for your transfer to the Airport or to the AVE train to Sevilla, Valencia or Barcelona (you can take the Sol Metro to Atocha Station to connect with the AVE train). In addition, you can take the Sol Metro to Chamartin, another Rail Station in Madrid. Definitely, we recommend this hotel, specially for Christmas.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday week in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Travelerwithkids65
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel in a great location. Clean, friendly staff, great restaurant attached, quiet despite being in the middle of the action. Rooms are not heavily decorated so don't expect an old style European Hotel, but everything is clean, bathrooms are modern, elevators are accessible. We booked four rooms and had a mix of locations... one with a balcony overlooking Puerta Del Sol (great for the party crowd), one overlooking the side streets (good people wathcing) and two on the interior (quiet and relaxing). Metro and High Speed Rail lines are literally steps away...you are a 10-15 minute walk from every major attraction in Madrid and within steps to unbelievable restaurants, nightclubs, shoping...etc!

Reviews.Title: “A Great hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: BDiaz
Reviews.Content: Last November, We visited for first time the city of Madrid and the Hotel Europa made our visit to this great city very memorable. After months of researching and based on the good reviews from TA travelers and also Rick Steves’ Madrid and Toledo guide, we decided to use the Hotel Europa as our second home away from USA while we were visiting the city of Madrid. The reservation process was very smooth. As soon as we decided to stay at this hotel, I immediately sent them an e-mail inquiring about availability, prices, services and cancelation policies and Mr. Garaban, always responded to my e-mails in a very promptly manner. He answered all my questions and gave me all the information that I need it. After sent them a couple of e-mails and talked to them on the phone, I was able to send my reservation by e-mail and I received the confirmation e-mail from Mr. Garaban a few minutes later. Unfortunately, we were forced to change our entire trip itinerary a few weeks prior to our trip to Madrid due to changes on the airline’s schedule. So I had to contact the hotel in order to modify our reservation and without any problems Mr. Garaban updated our reservation. Check in-out: When we arrived in the early morning hours to the hotel, the check in process was very fast. When it was time for us to check out they had our check ready and it did not have any hidden fees. The guys on the front desk were very friendly and efficient. Room: Because we arrived around 8:00AM the room that I requested previously (double bed-matrimonial) was not ready, they told us that there was a room ready with a double bed which was like two twin beds put together. Honestly, because we were so tired, we did not care about the type of bed so we accepted that room. To our surprise, the room was located in the fourth floor and it was one of the corner rooms. It has two windows and we were right in front of Puerta Del Sol. This room overpassed our expectations. For us it was amazing! The room had a double bed (two twins beds put together), an LCD TV with international channels, a big closet, a desk, a safety box which you need to pay a fee if you are using it and of course the room has a big and clean bathroom. Noise level: Our room was sound and light proof BUT because this room is right on Puerta Del Sol, we heard some noise. Not a big deal for us but If you are a light sleeper, you should bring earplugs. One thing that I want to add and please do not take this comment as a negative for the hotel on the contrary I think is more like an interesting fact is that if you are in the rooms facing Puerta del Sol and if you are in bed, you will feel some light tremors. These tremors are very light and are caused because underneath of Puerta Del Sol is the train-metro station, therefore every time that a train-metro passes, you will feel the tremor. I don’t know if the guests on the interior rooms feel the tremors but I did when we stayed in the rooms facing Puerta Del Sol. Interesting fact! I would like to write more good things about this hotel but I don’t want to make this review like an essay. The only thing that I know is that if I go back to Madrid, I will stay again at the hotel Europa without any doubts.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: OahuHawaii
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at this Madrid hotel. Perfect location...in the center of Puerto del Sol. Room had hardwood floors, ceiling to floor window that opened like french doors, comfy bed, nice size bathroom with bidet, toilet, shower/tub, hairdryer, etc. Good size closet. Hotel was quiet and clean. Good a/c. Free internet at computer in lobby. Helpful staff that gave good directions, tour tips, etc. Hotel is within easy walking to MANY places of interest/sights, good restaurants, shopping. etc. Area felt safe. Many tables & chairs facing out on the patio for great people-watching. We enjoyed that SOOO much...it was a nightly event. Good food and wine. We would gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: susanL912
Reviews.Content: just returned from a weekend in Madrid.Hotel room was lovely very clean and warm, we had a room facing the square which was noisy but once windows closed it was not too bad it was worth it to be able to view the hustle and bustle and our room looked directly onto the xmas tree. Breakfast was basic but a good start to day.Excellent location for the sights and sounds of madrid.Would definately stay there again.Staff were very nice too.

Reviews.Title: “Great, well priced hotel in Sol!”
Reviews.Author: snod73
Reviews.Content: Hotel Europa has the best location!! Right in the middle of Sol. I got a room with a balcony facing the square. It was noisy...as the Spanish typically sing and dance late in to the night. However, the room was not as noisy with all the doors closed. Room is pretty basic. Clean. Showers were good and bathroom well maintained. Shower amenities were not so great. Best you bring your own stuff. There is a restaurant / coffee shop available. I ate breakfast here every day. internet was free in the lobby. (wireless). (they also had a couple of PC's with internet access in the lobby) OVerall nice, safe and clean hotel. The front desk staff were very knowledgeable And willing to help with directions, etc. THey all spoke English, which was very useful!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Janet L
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent 3 nights and 4 days at the Hotel Europa it was very nice. Located right in the center of the Puerta del Sol and steps from the Metro. The hotel itself was nice. Free wifi which is always a plus. Friendly staff and the rooms were nice. Our room was on the second floor facing the Puerta del Sol and the noise was very minimal. The restaurant next door to the hotel was fine nothing special. We would recommend this hotel to anyone coming to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Europa Madrid Spain - Great Hotel and Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: BreckColorado
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Europa in Madrid, Spain is in the city center and on the Puerta del Sol plaza (the most popular locals and tourist sqaure in Madrid). The hotel is great shape and the service is excellent. The employees were friendly and helpful, and all front desk personell spoke English as well as other languages. We opted to pay the extra 10 Euros per night for a premium room and it was well worth it. We had room 431 which was a corner room with two balconies facing the plaza. The room had a desk with two chairs and we used the chairs to sit on the balacony and people watch when we weren't off doing something else. I highly recommend paying the little extra for a premium room! Most everything is in walking distance - restaurants, small grocery stores, all types of shopping, museums, churches/cathedrals and the Palace. Getting to the hotel from the airport was easy via the Metro for 2,50 Euros each (much less than a cab at about 30,00 Euros. The hotel provided directions via the Metro ahead of time, and when you climb out the Metro steps, face the buildings to your right, and the hotel entrance is on the street slightly to the left and about 20 meters up the street. Getting back to the airport was just as easy. The only negative comment is the hotel expects you to leave the room key (the typical disposable plastic magnetic strip key) at the front desk everytime you leave, then pick it up upon your return. I always find this an annoying activity at many European hotels, since my comings and goings should not be the business of the front desk. Overall, the Hotel Europa in Madrid was a great hotel with the absolute best location!

Reviews.Title: “Right in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: los4caracoles
Reviews.Content: We arrived Christmas Day in 2010. Super-clean rooms with balcony (for more $$, but definitely worth it). Modern and comfortable. Everything was great except -- the towels were thin and wimpy! Surprising at such an otherwise nice place. Traveled with 2 teenage children and 2 adults. Loved the adjoining rooms with a shared foyer, leading to one door to the hallway. We stayed for 3 nights and hopped the metro (right in Puerta del Sol) to everything! Fantastic location. Would definitely stay here again. It can get noisy late at night because you are right where the action is -- and the action can go on quite late.

Reviews.Title: “Location!”
Reviews.Author: Chrystianne
Reviews.Content: If this is your first time in Madrid or you want to be close to the action this hotel is for you. It is on a pedestrian street near the famous Plaza del Sol (geographical center of Spain). The staff all speak English, are very courteous, and the rooms are clean. It can be a bit noisy at night if there is late night partying at the nearby bars. There is no WiFi in the hotel room but there are two free computers in the lobby for your use. Also attached to the hotel is a restaurant frequented by visitors and locals with outside tables as well.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Mary052010
Reviews.Content: Staying at Hotel Europa worked out great for our 5 days in Madrid. It's right off the Puerta del Sol and a short walk to the Metro which we used for side trips to Segovia, Toledo and Avila. We also walked to/from the Prado Museum which was handy. Breakfast was not included in our room rate but we ate at the restaurant connected with the hotel and it worked just fine. A former trip advisor writer complained about the walk from the taxi drop-off to the hotel. It was NOT an issue for us at all. A straight shot just about a block down from where the taxi could get closest. Rooms were clean, staff was courteous & helpful and i liked free Internet in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in the heart of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: RainCityEscapeArtist
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful 3 night stay at this hotel. It was the 2nd time staying there for the couple we traveled with. Front desk staff was very helpful. We asked them to arrange a taxi to the Madrid address where a fellow traveler had been born 75 years ago. They saved us money by showing us a simple route to get there by public transport! The hotel is right above the metro line, very convenient from the airport if you are willing to take the metro. Our balcony overlooked Puerto del Sol, which is busy night and day - much fun to sit and watch the constant activity. But once our door was closed, it was surprisingly very quiet. The attached restaurant had nice breakfasts and we loved the tapas and sangria at their street-side seating area!! Excellent service. Simple but clean room. Close to many of the must-see sites. I'd highly recommend a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Location and So Much More”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraElizabeth
Reviews.Content: A very good value hotel. Perfect location. Very well managed with excellent front desk service. Clean and quiet. Good water pressure and air conditioning. Felt safe and secure. Free internet in the lobby, along with all the current guide books available to browse on a table. Loved the sidewalk cafe attached to the hotel. We took the Autobus Express (2 euros) from the airport, and rolled our suitcases from the Plaza de Cibeles (preferring this to taking the metro and changing lines). Once settled in, we walked everywhere for the next 3 days. Was fully booked, so reserve ahead!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, in the center of the action”
Reviews.Author: chucksf
Reviews.Content: Comfortable hotel at Puerta de Sol. Nice cafe for breakfast and light meals. Efficient staff. Clean. Liked it

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Location, Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: czapata
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right in the middle of Madrid, in front of the Sol Metro Station and right in Plaza del Sol. Plaza Mayor is about 10 minute walk, same with Gran Via. It is located within walking distance from all mayor sites in Madrid. The rooms are very clean. No free wifi, but they offer two computers so you can access the internet from free. Plaza del Sol gets very crowded and noisy during the night, so make sure you request an interior room. Ours was an interior room and it was very quiet. Staff is not super friendly but they were helpful every time I asked for assistance. I would stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Adam S
Reviews.Content: Great location, near metro, puerto de sol, plaza mayor, and the palace. Hotel room was nothing special but the staff was the most helpful out of all my stays. Also liked that one of the men at the front desk spoke American Engish perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Tanaki47
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 5 nights recently. Good, competent reception desk. Courteous staff. Clean new rooms. Near to a Metro station. Some taxis dared not come in (pedestrian street) , but even if they dropped you a short distance away, it is a short downhill walk. They wud come in to the front door if the hotel phones them.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: vero465
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times. This hotel is perfect for a stay in Madrid. The hotel is located in the heart of the city. The metro is on the corner, the streets are full of life, lots of shopping, bars and restaurants. All attractions are in walkingdistance. The staff is very helpful and sweet. The rooms are clean, large and comfortable. No breakfast or minibar. The hotel has a restaurant with both indoor and outside serving. If you have a room with a view to the streets, it can be a little noisy, but it never bothered me.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, interior rooms”
Reviews.Author: Dr.Steve
Reviews.Content: Even in the midst of a large demonstration, our interior rooms were quiet. The room itself was small with two double beds. The floral smell, annoying when we first entered the room, disappeared when we opened the doors to the inner courtyard. An annoying light over the door was helped with eye shades. We stayed there only one night to catch an early flight. Location was very central, and even though the mass protest kept the taxis from taking us there, its proximity to metro station Sol provided a fairly easy and direct path from the Atoche rail station. This was our last night of a 7 day trip and I am glad we had only booked one night here.

Reviews.Title: “What a view of the Puerta del Sol! Excellent service too.”
Reviews.Author: Gigis_mum
Reviews.Content: Hotel Europa is clean, comfortable, surprisingly soundproofed and well-staffed. Some rooms face the Puerta del Sol. When we booked directly with the hotel, we had asked for a quiet room with a balcony. At check-in, we were given a room that faced an internal corridor. No great view of the Puerta del Sol. When I questioned this assignment, the gentleman at the front desk explained that the quiet rooms were in the back and that he was honouring our original request. We decided to take our chances with noise and move to a room facing Puerta del Sol. It was a good move. Once the shutters and French doors were closed, the room became an oasis of calm. In fact, the only disruptive noise we heard that night was from an English-speaking family in the corridor. They had gone out late to buy McDonald’s for dinner and the family was arguing about who would eat which burger (how do you say in Spanish, “Please remember to use your indoor voices and try the local food…”?). Thus, we were able to enjoy the sights and sounds of the plaza from our balcony as well as get a wonderful night of sleep. Before we arrived, I had emailed the hotel to ask for help with a restaurant reservation. Even 4-5 star hotels are not always too good about this kind of request. To my delight and surprise, I received a confirmation within a day. Hotel Europa's Señor Garabán even gave me the name of his contact at the restaurant (in case there was any mistake). Such thoughtful and professional service!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: BTH904
Reviews.Content: Our trip had us arriving in Madrid for a few days, travel around the country for a few days and then back to Madrid. We had a different hotel booked for our return to Madrid, however, we loved the Hotel Europa so much, we decided to cancel our reservations and return. Although the second hotel was a more luxurious hotel, you can't beat the location (Pureto del Sol), convenience (5-15 walk to so many attractions), right by metro stop and energy of the location. The rooms were clean and roomy (we had a triple). Although we had an interior room, it was very quiet considering we were right off of Puerto del Sol. The staff was wonderful friendly and recommended so great places for us to eat. Overall, the hotel was an excellent value and experience.

Reviews.Title: “LOVELY HOTEL WITH AN EXCELLENT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: HEARTSTOPPER22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Europa for three nights for our anniversary. It is located in the famous Puerta Del Sol, which is within walking distance to the majority of the major attractions, 5 min walk to the Gran Via and the metro station is a two minute walk from the front door of the hotel. The hotel has a nice reception and the staff were very helpful in giving directions and advice, their English was very good. The hotel has a restaurant with a large seating area indoor and outdoors. Our room was spacious with a lovely balcony that faced into Calle Del Carmen which was nice, when the window was closed it really blocked the sound out from outside which was good as it was very busy at night. The room had a safe and a good sized plasma tv. The bathroom was nice too, very spacious and marble all over. I Can 100% recommend this hotel for location and price and when travelling to Madrid again this will definitely be where we will lay our hat.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in fantastic city”
Reviews.Author: toolbox99
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Clean, efficient staff, fantastic location. Would def recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: pdxtraveler12
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a perfect location for a stay in Madrid. It's right on the Puerto del Sol, which is lively at all times of day and night, and within walking distance of all the major tourist attractions, as well as being near many restaurants and tapas bars. The metro is right there as well, so easy access to the airport. The rooms are large, comfortable and extremely clean, everything you would expect. The staff was very helpful with suggestions on places to eat and recommendations for nightlife. Would definitely stay there again on our next visit to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms, and staff”
Reviews.Author: bkokoski
Reviews.Content: I am American, and this hotel was very good. We stayed on two occasions within 2 weeks at the Madrid location. Our price was 110 Euro per night including tax. Rooms are big, bathrooms are big, TV was great with many channels, sound-proof windows, located on Puerta del Sol plaza, excellent English-speaking staff, restaurant conveniently located on ground level, good A/C, clean room, fair beds. Walking distance to Palace, museums, parks, train station, tapas bars, shopping, and much more. Excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Madrid at you fingertips”
Reviews.Author: diegoclan
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in the middle of Madrid. Call in advance and make sure to book your room with a balcony overlooking the Plaza Del Sol. The metro station is less than one block from the hotel. You are within walking distance to the Royal Palace, the Cathedral and most of the major Plazas (Mayor and Espana). The rooms were clean and very comfortable. The staff was courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: flapsy45
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the middle of the action of Madrid. We loved being so close to Puerto del Sol, and we definitely felt the heartbeat of the city. That being said, our room was quiet and peaceful. The staff were very helpful and we always had everything we needed. We loved this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The Best New Year's Eve in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: elyrivera
Reviews.Content: Six friends and I spent 10 days in Spain from December 29, 2010 until January 7, 2011. Three of us stayed at Hotel Europa, which is located just in Puerta del Sol, which is the center of the Old Madrid in kilometer 0. On the New Years Eve, most of the spanish citizens celebrate in Puerta del Sol, so it is very crowded. We bought bottles of Cava (Spanish Sparkling Wine), the twelve grapes, cheese, bread, etc. and spend the night in our room but in the Balcony, which has a spectacular view of Puerta del Sol. Our room was very clean, wooden floor. Be advised that you have to pay daily for the Security Box and also for the Wi-fi. In the Hotel Lobby they have two Computers with Internet free of charge. The hotel is very centrally located in front of Sol Metro Station. Around you can find shops, cafeterias, Restaurants and Theaters. Also, it is very near Plaza Mayor, Alcalá Street and the most famous avenue, La Gran Vía, which is also called Avenida José Antonio. T

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jeff N
Reviews.Content: We had a triple room with lots of space. The room was a very large interior room that was very quiet. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The location was perfect for touring and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, very nice location”
Reviews.Author: bobby88472
Reviews.Content: This hotel was after a long search online our compromise between paying a bit more and not having to stay in a crappy hotel. It turned out that this hotel exceeded our expectations by far! We had a really spacious and clean room with a little balcony towards Puerta del Sol. Double blinds kept the light and noise from the street out. The location is brilliant if you want to do some sightseeing in Madrid. Going out is also not a problem, since the hotel is accessible the entire night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: beram63
Reviews.Content: Hotel Europa is located right on the Puerta Del Sol, which puts you right in the heart of the city's transportation and "Old Town" scene--an easy walk to both Plaza Mayor and Santa Ana for tapas and night life. The air-conditioned rooms were of a good size, tastefully decorated (I thought) and clean. There's a shower and a good hairdryer in the bathroom. We had a room with a balcony over the square, which made for very entertaining people-watching late at night with a cool breeze and a bottle of wine. I know some people complained about the noise level on the Puerta del Sol, especially those who stayed during the protests. We did hear some of that going on, but it was during the day when, by all rights, you should be out seeing the incredible city you came to visit. Also, with the AC, outer shutters, windows, and heavy drapes, it was easy to blot out the noise. I also thought the adjoining cafe was a great place to stop off for cafe or croissant or tortilla and fresh-squeezed orange juice (our favorite breakfast of champions) in the morning before diving back into the city at large. I thought the staff at the front desk were also friendly and helpful with pretty good English when you need it. One concierge in particular was instrumental in helping us figure out directions to various spots around the city and to the train station for our jaunt from Madrid to San Sebastian. Some people complained about leaving the key at the front desk, which is just a silly thing to harp on. In all honesty, it's for everyone's safety. The heart of any big city has unsavory characters roaming around, and the key system enables the staff to monitor that everyone who comes in is staying there. It never took more than 10 second to get the key at the desk when we came in. My one and only complaint is that there was no access to an iron--not in the room and not at the front desk. There was a laundry service where you could pay something like 7 euro to have an article of clothing pressed, but it required a day to turn it around. When I get into town and I'm pulling clothes out of a suitcase, rumpled and full of creases, I need an iron. As an American in Europe, I'm sensitive about looking like a slob, and we basically had no other choice for our first night in town. Hotel Europa: get an iron for patrons to borrow at the front desk please; it's sort of common sense and a relatively cheap investment.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: madridtodonostia
Reviews.Content: Clean, great location, nice staff. Ask for a room on the top floor with a balcony...it is worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Love Hotel Europa”
Reviews.Author: BeachipichiNJ
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Madrid. This is my third visit to the city in the last ten years and we have stayed at Hotel Europa on each visit. We love Hotel Europa and wouldn’t stay anywhere else. The hotel is ideally located in Puerta del Sol, smack in the middle of Madrid. Anything worth seeing is either a short walk or a Metro ride away. We have always found the hotel spotlessly clean, the staff very courteous, competent, and helpful. The cafeteria attached to the hotel is good, but a bit pricey because of its location in Puerta del Sol. Comparable food is definitely less expensive once you leave the Sol area. A good and inexpensive place for lunch is Montadito’s, located between Sol and Opera, and in other locations around the city. Montadito’s serves small bocadillos for around one to two euros (three makes a meal)—it’s good and you can’t go wrong. Eating in Madrid can be expensive if you’re not careful; a bit of advice to first time visitors to Spain—when sitting at an eatery with wait staff service, be sure to check your bill carefully. First of all, you will be charged for bread, olives, or any extras that are brought to your table (whether or not you wanted it). This can add a considerable amount to your bill, and it’s usually a per person charge. If you don’t want the extras, be sure to tell them when you sit down, that way you won’t be charged for something you don’t want. The same holds true for water. They usually don’t bring you tap water, but instead they ask if you want “con gas” or “sin gas” (carbonated or non-carbonated), and, of course, they’ll bring you bottled water for the table for which you’ll be charged.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION WAS AMAZING AND HOTEL WAS GOOD”
Reviews.Author: LOVETOTRAVEL1707
Reviews.Content: The location to the hotel was more than amazing, located right in the center of Madrid. Near by are many shops, restaurants etc. Plaza major is about a 10 minute walk, as well as the royal palace and many other historic attractions. The hotel is okay, pretty small but okay. Bathroom size was small and overall it was very clean. Staff is friendly most of the times especially at the restaurant (which is a bit expensive) but when I checked out and asked to get something from my luggage he basically responded by saying my luggage was all the way to the back (not such great hospitality). Also I inquired about using a phonecard to call the us, he said I wouldnt be charged if I used a phonecard but called me two days later to say I had phone charges and how it had to be a certain phonecard to no be charged. Also safe in the room is 2 euro per day which is also good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, reliable hotel but let down by its restaurant”
Reviews.Author: croftonMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Europa for 4 nights at the end of June. Check in was efficient and the reception staff speak good English and were always helpful with directions or advice. We chose to avoid a front room which overlooks the plaza at Puerta del Sol due to the noise from this popular plaza at night and were allocated a room that looks out to an internal courtyard at our request, This was a standard room and at EUR92 (+8% tax), it is competitively priced for its central location. We booked directly through Europa’s web site which had prompt and friendly replies. For us the location was perfect, in a walking area of shopping, restaurants and entertainment, Madrid is a city where “down-town” is still the hub of the city and is served by municipal buses and a metro station “Sol”, and close to the hop on, hop off bus. Limited vehicular access means that you must walk about two small blocks from taxi to hotel, but no further than the metro station. It is easily found, up the Calle that is directly behind the tail of the horse in the Sol statue. Hotel Europa is within easy walking distance to Plaza Mayor, Mercado San Miguel and Palacio Real. Our standard room was clean and neat with good light from the courtyard/ light well, bathrooms were clean and a good shower. The room contents are typically Spanish, with no refrigerator or mini bar, no tea making and the room safe costs EUR2.00 per day. We were heading for a 4.5 star rating but marked it down due to the breakfast “restaurant”. It is busy, also serving the bar area and public alfresco dining on the pavement. The food was OK, with delicious Spanish pain (bread rolls) and churros (croissants) and one morning we had the scrambled eggs with jamon (ham) and the food was not a problem, but when we requested an English language menu we were abruptly told (in an unfriendly manner) there wasn’t one – which is strange, when every other menu in the hotel room and restaurant have English interpretations (after all this is a tourist hotel). The “salon” (inside the restaurant) is not a happy place, where there is much gesticulation and raised (sometimes angry) voices – this may be a Spanish cultural characteristic but we did not experience it in a public restaurant anywhere else. The retorts came from a few employees, not just a waiter who was having a bad day. The salon is so unpleasant that we chose to eat elsewhere for our Spanish food enjoyment – despite the much vaunted Spanish food quality on their menu. This is a pity as the lack of tourist friendliness will make us look elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: Sophronia
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the best we stayed at in Europe through our many travels. The room was spacious and had a lovely modern bathroon. There was a small balcony and our room oversaw the outdoor dining area/terrace that the hotel had to offer, as well as part of the Puerta del Sol. It was a nice respite to return each evening from a long day of walking around and sit outside. Some evenings we had a full meal and other evenings we just had a pitcher of sangria and tapas or dessert. SERVES THE BEST PAELLA WE'VE EVER HAD! The terrace is a great place for people watching as it is in the pedestrian zone! This hotel is near a lot of the action and very convenient to the Metro. We mainly walked to everything from here, though. The staff was very helpful whenever we had questions regarding directions or dinner recommendations. There is free internet and wi-fi access in the lobby (and latter in the cafeteria). Three dining options at the hotel - bar, cafeteria, terrace.

Reviews.Title: “If you like excitement, here is the place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: KokaneeGold
Reviews.Content: Located right on the foot of Puerto del Sol, you'll never have peace. But I enjoyed it be because it's convenient where ever you are going. If you want to feel the vive of Madrid, I think you'll find no place better.

Reviews.Title: “Fine but not wonderful”
Reviews.Author: maggie10lou
Reviews.Content: We too stayed at this hotel during the demonstrations. Our room overlooked the square and it was impossible to sleep at night for the noise. The room was fine - clean and very basic. I did not find the front desk staff to be very friendly or helpful and this was a big negative for us. As patrons of the establishment I expect to be treated in a courteous and helpful manner and this was not the case. Location was good except for the demonstrations. Food at restaurant was expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Bare bones hotel with unhappy front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: Bikegal
Reviews.Content: Without a doubt the ONLY thing this hotel has going for it is its central location. You can walk to many of the City's sights and it puts you right in the heart of the city. We were also in the hotel at the time of the demonstrations - but it bothered us far more than other reviewers. It ruined our stay in Madrid as we were unable to move through Puerto del Sol without hitting protestors and huge groups. The hotel itself is VERY bare bones. Bed, bathroom, TV - nothing more. The restaurant downstairs is very expensive and prices for the room do not include any kind of breakfast. We were very disappointed with the front desk staff who were very unfriendly, many struggled with English, and were most unhelpful in finding a taxi and negotiating the demonstrations. They have PERFECTED being on PDS and the bustling activity with really wonderful sound-proof doors. But beware that being on PDS isn't always a good thing. Would NOT return to Hotel Europa mostly due to being too central/noisy/crowded and rude Front Desk Staff.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good value”
Reviews.Author: jandtpeters
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Europa on New Year's Eve. We chose it because it was on Puerta Del Sol, the epicenter of Madrid's NYE activities, and it was fairly priced-- much cheaper than other nearby places. It is a great location if you want to be in the heart of the tourist area. As in any popular locale, there are the usual street vendors and buskers out on Puerta Del Sol. We generally try to avoid the hordes in this type of area, but if that's what you're looking for, you can't get more central than Hotel Europa and there is a Metro stop just outside the door. The staff was friendly and the hotel was generally comfortable, especially considering the price. But, there were a few drawbacks that kept this from being a 4- or 5-star stay: -The walls are quite thin, and we had a lot of noise from the hallway and neighboring rooms. We could clearly hear conversations on the floor above through the air vent. It felt like they were in our room with us! -Guests are required to leave their keys at the front desk while out of the hotel, which means an extra stop every time you come or go. -The free WiFi is only available in the lobby. -There is a fee to use the safe, which they highly recommend you use. So, it wasn't perfect, but it's hard to complain too much when we got a good deal for a major holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and perfect for our family trip”
Reviews.Author: Henry220
Reviews.Content: Our room overlooked Puerta del Sol so hotel is in a great location, Double paned french doors keep out almost all street noise. Rooms are very clean and tasteful. It is an old hotel that has been updated recently, and they keep it spotless. Lots of marble everywhere. Rooms are standard european (small but reasonable) size. Staff were courteous and attentive. A Rick Steves recommendation for a good value and I agree.

Reviews.Title: “Location is simply fatastic!”
Reviews.Author: stretchaleg
Reviews.Content: This hotel is walking distance (1km) from the yellow airport shuttle bus in the down town area. We had the local pub for Sangria, Spanish Ham Museum, flameco dance performance (Cardamomo) and cool neighbourhood all in the walking distance. We enjoyed the view from the balcony and the student demonstration didn't really bother us at all. We would recommend this place to stay for other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: LindseyLN
Reviews.Content: Mu husband and I stayed at Hotel Europa May 20th and then again May 27th before our flight out of Madrid. Pros: 1. Rick Steve's never steers us wrong. Great location, you can walk everywhere, even the train station which we did (all downhill there, but beware, what goes down must go up). Great restaurants close by, shopping, can't get a better hotel for the price and location in Madrid. 2. Nice, clean rooms and large bathrooms with a tub. TV had a few English channels so we could have something on in the background we could understand while in the room. 3. We flew into Madrid and just got a taxi to the hotel, it was around 30 euros and totally worth it. The drive was about 20 minutes. There is also a taxi stop right around the corner from the hotel which is very convenient. 4. Jim. Look no further if you are from the states. He is super helpful and always has a smile as well as great suggestions for eating out. 5. They kept our extra bag for us for the week and then when we got there the night before our flight out the bag was sitting in the room for us! Perfect. Cons: 1. Our flight was delayed out of Chicago therefore missing our connection to Madrid in Philly. So we were not able to get to Madrid until the next day. I emailed Hotel Europa explaining the problem and asked if we could NOT be charged for the 19th. Of course we didn't have a 24 hour notice so they did charge us. Fortunately we had trip insurance and are hoping to get refunded for that amount. Just be aware of the cancellation policy. 2. The wireless internet doesn't work in the rooms, but it does in the lobby and in the hallways sometimes.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: davidhuerta
Reviews.Content: This hotel couldn't have been more centrally located. Just meters off the plaza of Puerta Del Sol, with its very own Metro stop. Within walking distance of the Gran Via, Plaza Mayor, The Royal Palace. The rooms were spacious, the service excellent. Would most definitely return. D. Huerta

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrsIngleby
Reviews.Content: The location is the best thing about this busy hotel. With Sol metro station on the doorstep and cafes, bars, shops and other attractions within walking distance. Pay a little more for your room than other hotels but it's worth it. Room spotless and bed comfortable. Bathroom facitlites good. I stayed when the Spaniards were demonstrating and camping in the square o/s hotel. I wish I had been informed of that. My taxi was unable to drop me and the luggage o/s the door. Top tip - take earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a nice room, well-kept hotel, amazing location”
Reviews.Author: ninaSF
Reviews.Content: -- Solo female traveler --Didn't notice anything wrong with the beds, as some folks have complained about --Bathroom was amazing--huge, had everything including bidet, super clean --Bedroom was quite adequate size, those complaining about room size must have had different types of rooms--in Europe the rooms aren't usually standardized. --Totally quiet (I asked for a quiet room and it looked out onto an air shaft but I was fine with that) --Price is really pretty great for this type of hotel. In the US it would be twice the price for that quality. -- I was lucky enough to be there during the (peaceful but sometimes noisy) protests in the Puerta del Sol, so I saw a little history being made and the hotel was still quiet. I was very happy to have made the decision to stay here, despite my fears about staying in what was potentially a noisy area. It was a bit of a splurge for my last day of vacation. It was so central and I could go up to the room, rest, and go out again so easily. Also, so close to the metro--easy to get to the airport and train station.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, clean modern rooms, great service”
Reviews.Author: rickinaus
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at Hotel Europa very much. The location is perfect, just off Puerto del Sol, one block to the metro and just a few metro stops to the train station and the Prado. The rooms are clean and modern. The front desk staff is friendly, helpful and courteous. Double or triple glazed doors open to the square or an interior courtyard-type view. One day the maid stopped by to ask if anything else needed to be done. Employees in the lobby are eager to provide any information requested and seem to genuinely care about the guests' comfort. I was impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous Value...Unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: Bonnyj
Reviews.Content: You cannot find a more perfect, central location in Madrid. Don't let the 1 star rating fool you, this is a great hotel. The staff are warm and welcoming. Everyone also speaks very good English for those of us that do not speak much Spanish. We had an interior room which overlooked the courtyard. It was bright and quiet. The adjacent cafe is handy. They serve excellent coffee and fresh oj, as well as a nice breakfast, lunch or dinner. Service is professional and courteous. I would definitely choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; nice and clean;”
Reviews.Author: roxane1223
Reviews.Content: We stayed (2 adults, one teen) for three nights and were perfectly satisfied. The room was large enough for 3 and the bathroom was spacious. The location was perfect - Puerta del Sol. We had never been to Madrid, so this made getting around the city as easy as can be. Free WiFi.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Uri098
Reviews.Content: 5o metres from SOL Metro. Clean rooms. Nothing fancy but clean and modern. Staff go out of their way to help. Food very good. Location Brill. Reasonably priced - you cant go wrong. Maybe noisy at the front in season - but that's Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location,location”
Reviews.Author: windycity_773
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Europa is in a great location, close to restaurants, shops, the metro. Walking distance to the museums. The rooms are basic but very clean and the staff is very accomodating. The beds are very hard! No frills in the room, just beds and a wardrobe. Ask for a room facing the inner courtyard as it's quieter. The cafeteria next door serves decent breakfast and drinks. Free wifi in the lobby and also worked in our room, although a weaker signal. Great value for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: DawsonDoll
Reviews.Content: On my first trip to Madrid I could not have picked a better hotel for its location (right on the Plaza del Sol), quality and price. I enjoyed EVERYTHING about my stay. It was "squeaky" clean. Thanks to a previous post I was able to find my way from the airport right to the hotel using the metro. Didn't realize until MUCH later that there are elevators in the metro stations! After dragging my luggage up hundreds of steps I finally found an elevator as they are not clearly marked. Finding the hotel after emerging from the metro station wasn't as difficult as I imagined. If the bear and tree monument is on your right....look to the left and you will see the hotel. The sign is not visible from the Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed at a fair price”
Reviews.Author: RedfishDave
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 nights at the Hotel Europa, March 4-11. Our first impression was very good, check-in was professional and quick. We were escotred to our room by a frienly gentleman whom is originally from Great Britan. All front desk staff spoke english and were very helpful. The hotel is completely spotless! So clean, in fact, I found myself looking for a sign of dirt and couldn't find any. We had a room overlooking the Plaza. Our room was about the size of a standard hotel room in the US with good closet and storage space. The "king bed" is two twin beds pushed together as is typical in europe. If I could change anything about the room, It would be nice if there were a picture or two hanging on the walls. Two people can get ready in the bathroom. It is marble with a glass shower door and has ample counter space. Take your own wash cloth as none are provided. I didn't spend much time watching TV but it is about a 32 inch flat screen with remote and receives, at least, 2 english news channels. We never found the thermostat adjustment but the room was usually at a good temperature. Don't forget to leave your room key at the front desk when you leave your room and pick it up when you return. Once again, normal for a european 1-2 star hotel. When you return to your room, place the key in the spot near the door to activate lights, etc. The day we left they were removing the door between the lobby and the restaurant/cafe next door. I'm sure they have their reasons, but it was very nice to get coffee in the morning without having to walk out on the "street" to go next door. Finally, the location is fantastic and even though our room was on the busy Plaza, noise was never an issue. Have fun in Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but a few quibbles - hidden internet charges, and tax”
Reviews.Author: corrcullen
Reviews.Content: This could have been a perfect stay if it wasnt for a few quibbles. On a positive note, the location is excellent. However, I rang them before I booked the room to check if they had internet in the rooms. I was told they had cable internet in the rooms, and it was free. However, when I arrived with my laptop, but there was no cable in the room, I was then told that I had to rent the cable for 2 euro per day. I was very disappointed that they didnt tell me this when I specifically phoned them about this, especially when I had a load of internet cables at home. The other thing is, when you are booking the room, the price is excluding tax. I think the price should be included when you are booking. I did not find it a very relaxing hotel to stay in, they staff seem very suspicious, and are very watchful of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: LauraJane83
Reviews.Content: Myself and 3 girlfriends stayed at the Euopa for 2 nights (Fri/Sat) in October 2010. We took a tube from the airport (about 20 mins), which brings you out in the square opposite the hotel. It did take us a while to figure out which hotel was the Europa, as the sign for it is actually down a side street, and not on the square. My best advice would be to stand in the middle of the square, with the 'bear climbing up the tree statue' to your right, and you should be facing the hotel. There were 4 of us in 1 room, and we had 4 twin beds, which was requested. Bathroom was clean, airy and there were plenty of towels for us all. Our balcony overlooked the cafe and part of the square. We did not find the room to be noisy, although we were getting in late and had a side view room. The square still seemed busy about 3/4am, so rooms overlooking the square may be noisier. You can pick up the open top sightseeing bus from the opposite side of the square. If you turn left out of the hotel and walk up the hill, you will find a great little market that sells leather goods and other trinkets. The shops of Gran Via are an easy stroll away The reception area is fine, friendly multilingual staff on reception 24 hours, and free internet in the reception area. For the price, this was a great place to stay right in a very good location

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: kaydc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right on the Puerta del Sol in the center of Madrid. We had a corner room and could watch the activity in the plaza. The room was comfortable and larger than many rooms in European hotels of this class. Price was reasonable, especially for a major city. The bathroom was especially large and well appointed. Staff were very helpful and the free computers in the lounge got us online with no problems. We ate breakfast a couple of mornings in the adjacent cafe and found it adequate. There are lots of good restaurants in the area. The one drawback that might bother some people is that there is a lot of activity in the plaza late at night. We slept well but light sleepers might need to ask for an interior room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a busy part of town”
Reviews.Author: jamonita
Reviews.Content: We were literally here just to sleep one night, but I will say that even though it is in the midst of Plaza del Sol (which is extremely busy and loud) the hotel took great care of ensuring their hotel and their rooms are kept safe. The room was clean and even though our windows faced the main square, the windows did a good job of keeping out the noise. There was no wi-fi and no mini-fridge, but we didn't need these things for our short stay. I don't care to stay in this part of town, but the hotel was decent.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Clean and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Kittypatrol
Reviews.Content: I liked Hotel Europa. The rooms were basic but extremely clean. The location cannot be beat. We stayed at Hotel Europa upon arriving in Madrid and again the night before we left Spain. Both rooms were nice. We had a courtyard view the first stay and a view of the plaza the second time. The view of the plaza was absolutely fantastic, and there was virtually no noise audible in the room from the lively plaza. I chose this hotel because Rick Steves recommended it and I'm glad I did!

Reviews.Title: “Great room with a view!”
Reviews.Author: tripfriends
Reviews.Content: Enter the hotel: simple, elegant and a very professional and friendly staff. Walk up the beautiful wood stairs with carpet runner ( or take elevator) to your room. Enter the spacious, very clean room and bath. Then head for the huge glass doors and open up to the small but perfect balcony and enjoy watching all the people go by. When your ready for quiet just close the doors. Everyone was friendly! Rick Steve's picked a great hotel here.

Reviews.Title: “I will NEVER stay at Hotel Europa again!”
Reviews.Author: ri10
Reviews.Content: Do NOT stay at Hotel Europa if you're single or have friends who will visit you during your stay at the hotel. This hotel enforces a strict 2 people per room policy (a friend and I stayed in the room), that borders on the comically ridiculous. Firstly, the front door is locked after midnight and hotel staff screen anyone coming into the hotel, and you can be interrogated and physically stopped from entering the hotel if they think 2 people are already in the room. I also pity any single guys/ladies that were sharing the room with a friend but wanted to take someone special back to their hotel room, it probably won't happen. The most shocking bit was that another friend who visited us in Madrid was not allowed to go to our room to use the toilet (during the day!), and the staff actually rudely shouted and called him back when we were casually walking to the elevator bank. I am still in disbelief! The hotel itself is clean, no-frills and in a good location, but cost me €100 per night. In short, you're much better off staying at one of the several other hotels nearby that costs much less and won't disrespect their guests. Personally, I will never stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nosy and judgmental front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: eecolson
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is fine--basic and no frills, but clean and in a good central location on Puerta del Sol. However, the (all-male) front desk staff made me feel uncomfortable. I am a thirtyish solo female traveler, and they were quite nosy about my comings and goings, especially later at night. It was made clear to me that they disapproved of my going out at night and coming back late--not a sense of concern for my well-being, but just general moral disapproval. After I had been there a few days, a male friend from home who was also in Madrid came to visit me at the hotel, and they refused to let him go up to my room, even though I was paying for a double room. Ugh.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: LondonStagman
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right there. Think Regent Street or Charing Cross Road in London or Times Square in New York. Very clean, very comfortable, efficient and close to everything. We had a family room, which is not ideal but on the 4th floor and amazingly quiet. On two mornings of the 4 we all slept in past 9 which, considering 4 in a room is very good. The only thing we didnt like was the fact that it is just a place to sleep. There is somewhere to have a meal or breakfast but this feels detached from the hotel and you dont actually get to meet other tourists. That is not essential but sometimes we have picked up good advice on places to go or visit in the breakfast room. In any event, you are spoilt for choices on where to eat. We loved going to the local coffee shop rammed with people on their way to work etc etc and there are so many Tapas bars, you wont go hungry.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: wildlife_lover
Reviews.Content: This is a relatively small modern hotel right off Puerta del Sol. This is a great location. There is a major Metro stop right there and lots of restaurants within walking distance. Also, it seemed like there was always something going on in the plaza – a band playing, skaters doing tricks, a magician etc. The rooms aren’t fancy, but are larger than a lot of hotels in Europe. Also, the front desk staff was extremely helpful – we were always asking them questions. Can’t tell you how many directions they gave us or things that they checked for us on the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean comfortable room, ideal accom”
Reviews.Author: Martha84
Reviews.Content: Right on Puerto del Sol,our room's balcony had a lovely view of the plaza. There were brilliant sound proof doors so we got a good nights sleep. This is a great base in madrid-you can basically walk to anywhere and the price is very reasonable for such a central location.Would not look past it!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: mattiedog99
Reviews.Content: Great location at the Puerto del Sol. Train station right outside, choice of many good restaurants and the plaza is abuzz all day and into the evening. Our window overlooked the plaza and the viewing was great. We were able to close the window (balcony door) and shut out the noise. The staff was very helpful. The room was adequate, far from plush but had what we needed. The restaurant attached was wonderful. Our waiter was the spitting image of Joe Pesci, both in looks and personality. Made the eating there even more fun. I'd stay here again without pause.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Friendly and prfessional staff--great cafeteria on premises.”
Reviews.Author: 30196Andy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed three nights at the Hotel Europa and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Our room overlooked the Puerta del Sol and so the view was fantastic. Very professional, friendly, and accomodating staff. Perfect location. If we ever get back to Madrid we will stay at Hotel Europa again.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the Center of Spain!”
Reviews.Author: WFT10S
Reviews.Content: The number one thing that the Europa has going for it is that it is central to Spain and central to Madrid. It's about the same distance from the hotel to go to the Prado or to the Palacio Real and the Cathedral. It's easy to stop by mid-day for a siesta to get in the Spanish spirit. Double paned glass kept the room quite although there is always activity in the square. Rooms were simple, but baths were spacious and attractive. Hotel agreed to give us the long-stay rate even though we split our trip by having 2 days in Madrid then 4 away and back for 5 at the Europa. Staff was attentive and helpful as needed. Strongly recommend based on location. Easy to step out your door and find a place to eat or drink with no effort. Hard to beat stepping out on your balcony and welcoming Puerto del Sol and Spain into your life each day and evening.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Charlie_From_Ohio
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Europa on two separate occasions in October 2010. Both times, I found the room to be clean, comfortable, and quiet. I had a room facing the interior courtyard and therefore experienced none of the street noise that others have commented on. The location is excellent right on Puerta del Sol.

Reviews.Title: “Location only good thing which can be said about this one star hotel”
Reviews.Author: tilly56Tilly56
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after reading some very positive comments on this website. However my experience was far from positive. Did not realized that the official rating which is on the wall outside the hotel in one star. Had i realised at the time of booking i would not have done so. We paid 100 euros for a one night stay (room only) The location was excellent but the hotel itself was disappointing. The room was sparsely furnished with scratched and damaged furniture which had seen better days. The bathroom also had some damage to the mirror and the plug was missing from the sink. Towels were very old almost threadbare. This was an inner room and whilst quiet had an emergency door with a light which shone above it all night. The reception staff were not really interested in you and there was no mention on arrival about breakfast. When we came down for breakfast the following morning we went into the restaurant obviously looking to find out what was available, staff were not interested so we went out to find some in a very nice bakery opposite McDonalds. Having had a wonderful stay in Salamanca this hotel was certainly a great disappointment but as it was thankfully only a one night stay bearable. I am wondering if we stayed at the same hotel as some of others

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, superb service, great restaurant, why stay anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: SpunkyBunks
Reviews.Content: On our last trip to Madrid, we stumbled upon this hotel and had a great breakfast. The outdoor seating area is cool too. On our current trip to Spain, we decided to give this place a shot so we stayed here. Boy, am I glad we did. The room was HUGE and it overlooked the busy pedestrian street below. Great people watching. It wasn't noisy at all too. And the staff were great too.

Reviews.Title: “Central, large rooms”
Reviews.Author: Whimsical_lv
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in Plaza del Sol so it is extremely central. We mostly walked everywhere from here. We picked this hotel based on a recommendation from Rick Steve's Spain 2010 guide book. All the rooms are standard prices with outside facing rooms costing a bit more. Nothing really exciting about this hotel, except for the location being quite central, rooms were clean and our room had a large bathrooom. No wifi except in the lobby but the hotel does have two computers you can use which has all the memory card slots to transfer photos etc.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a hotel in the heart of Madrid!”
Reviews.Author: waveseeker
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend in Madrid with our 4 year old and 1 year old and hotel Europa delivered on every count. It is located right on the Puerta del Sol, an amazing square that never seems to sleep. Despite the thousands of people milling about in the square and the noise of buskers and tourists, we did not hear a sound once in our large comfortable family room. The reason for this is there are rooms that face into an internal courtyard. It was incredible to be so close to all the action and yet able to sleep in silence! The rooms are extremely clean and our room was very large. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful (particularly when explaining how to get to the airport on public transport which, thanks to their helpful direction took us 30 minutes by train and metro, easily done with a pushchair a suitcase and a four year old!!! We had delicious churros and chocolate for breakfast in the restaurant attached to the hotel which gets really packed out during the day as it has a prime spot for people watching! We would definitely return to this great hotel and great city!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very nice room.”
Reviews.Author: Frankenbarb
Reviews.Content: Europa is located on the Puerto del Sol which is filled with action and is near lots of restaurants, a metro stop and a terrific location from which to see Madrid. Our room was decent size with a decent size but not large bath. It had balcony type windows on two sides which overlooked Puerto del Sol, a beehive of activity until the early morning hours. The only down side of the room was the noise which might impact a light sleeper. I loved it, but my wife needed to close the windows to sleep. The staff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Locations and Service!”
Reviews.Author: Laura15347
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! This hotel is in the heart of Madrid - Puerta del Sol and totally in the action and walking distance to just about everything we wanted to see in Madrid. Surprisingly, we were never woken by the action when we turned in (although we did have a room that faced the closed-in courtyard.) The location was fantastic but the staff was even better. The staff were friendly, spoke English very well (were patience with our attempts at Spanish), and were very accommodating. They were especially helpful when we wanted to see a Real Madrid game by giving us free advice on where in the stadium we should buy our seats. The rooms were also very clean and the restaurant was good for a quick breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent room, but check your bill”
Reviews.Author: Bob/Paula
Reviews.Content: The best thing about Hotel Europa is its location, a few steps from the wildly bustling Puerta del Sol, with Metro station right there and a raft of shops, attractions, restaurants and cervecerias close at hand. As a hotel per se, it's adequate. We asked for and got a room on the interior courtyard, and there was no noise at all. Our double room was ample size, though the twin mattresses were quite hard and might not be to everyone's taste. The desk staff were more efficient than they were welcoming, but they were helpful, informative, and available, with excellent English. The hotel cafeteria made a good breakfast choice, with the usual package continental breakfast but lots of other items available. Our problem is with the billing. There was a 2 Euro/day charge for the room safe, but OK, the room rate was reasonable even so. However, when we checked out, the bill was presented in dollars at a rate that was marked up 3% higher than the going exchange rate for that date. I questioned this, because we have discovered over time that we get the best possible rate when our credit card bank does it at their end, and was told it was "automatic." At the time, we were in a rush to catch a train, so that was that. I don't know who is pocketing the extra money, but over several days and several hundred dollars, it adds up. It seemed really sneaky, and is enough reason to overlook the pluses and give it thumbs down. If you do decide to stay here, please insist on billing in Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Value Hotel With Central Location”
Reviews.Author: HKFoodie
Reviews.Content: Great location overlooking Puerta del Sol. Very convenient as it is close to central metro subway station and pedestrian streets. Lobby looks dated but its large with many sofas to sit and access the free internet and they have two PCs for guest use. Hotel rooms are nice size and look like they have been recently updated although they are still basic. Double glazed windows mean you hear very little outside noise. Only complained is housekeeping started at 9 am so you can hear the vacuum cleaner in hallway. At Euro 92 p.n., I thought this was a bargain especially given the hotel's location.

Reviews.Title: “Surprise find”
Reviews.Author: lovetotrav0
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised with this Hotel. We had trouble finding a hotel in our price range and took this as a 2nd choice. We would stay again. Roomy rooms, great bathroom, very well maintained, helpful staff, and located right off Plaza del Sol, the city hub. We felt very safe here. Safe in room but you pay an extra 2 euro a night -- worth it. Decent restaurant downstairs if you dont feel like exerting yourself one night. Hotel provides only soap so bring toiletries. Beds are comfortable. This hotel is a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: QETelford
Reviews.Content: Hotel Europa was our first hotel in Spain. We arrived at around 8AM Madrid time, a bit jet lagged and somewhat disoriented. The staff were very friendly and let us check into our rooms right away. The hotel is on the Plaza del Sol which, as we discovered, is a real focal point for people and activity. The rooms (and bathrooms) were comfortably sized, very clean and stylish, with windows and small ledges opening out onto the Plaza where you could take a chair and sit and enjoy watching the crowd. From the Plaza del Sol, it is easy to get to the Palacio Real and to nice cafes and tapas bars. It is also very close to the main shopping boulevard. For us, a perfect base of tourism operations. My teenage daughters greatly appreciated the free internet at the computers in the lobby!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Travelstuff_10
Reviews.Content: Hotel Europa has the best location! It is in the heart of Puerta del Sol and walking distance to all the museums and Plaza Mayor. It is right in front of the metro and has tour buses across the street. The rooms are very clean and the staff is wonderful. It is very reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel very centrally located”
Reviews.Author: blockhouse
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in July (during a heat wave). The rooms were clean, the staff friendly and the room well air conditioned. The hotel was in a great location and made seeing all the important sights an easy walk. The only negatives I would mention are that the bedding was so-so and the towels were thin. The room was always clean (as was the hotel). Because I was traveling with my 2 kids, we chose the triple room which consisted of 3 twin beds. It was a bit "dorm" like but worked just fine. The room was modern (flat panel tv mounted on the wall) and the bathroom large and done in marble. We had an back room that opened to the other buildings but it was very quiet. A room on the front of the building I'm guessing would be noisy since the pedestrian streets are quite busy at night.

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location! Decent rooms and nice bathrooms!”
Reviews.Author: Kris69Mumbai
Reviews.Content: The wife and I stayed here for 2 night as the last leg of our Greece-Spain trip and were immensely surprised with the superb location, great price (it was the cheapest hotel we had on the trip), nice restaurant downstairs, big room and updated bathroom, free internet/computer in the lobby, room service and helpful staff! niggles with poor toileteries and and a safe where you pay 2Eur were easily dismissed! Bed was decent on comfort...though given it is on the square it does get noisy at night so, if you ae a light sleeper and want relaxation..not the ideal hotel...but for first timers its a treat to soak on Madrid! easy access to the bullfights, tapa bars and the markets, squares...it was great!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice family room in good location”
Reviews.Author: winniewms
Reviews.Content: Great central location just off the Puerto del Sol, just seconds from the subway and halfway between the Prado and the Palacio Real. Staff were helpful, the room spacious even for a family, very clean. Wireless internet was free down in the lobby, as were the use of two computers available to all. Small charge for printing. Cafe was good, and small breakfasts like churros and chocolate, or coffee and toast, were reasonably priced. Tapas and drinks were a little more, but the tapas were generous. Be aware of gypsies and pickpockets in the area. The staff cautioned us when we were returning to the airport with our luggage via the subway (taxis are nearby if you prefer). Be aware that you must keep your room key in a slot near the door in order for the lights and air to continue operating while you are in the room. When my husband took the key to enable the small safe in the room, we ended up without lights, though we appreciated their efforts at energy efficiency. Room was quiet, beds were very comfortable (4 single beds).

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good”
Reviews.Author: neseacoast
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on my first solo trip to Madrid. The location was perfect for walking to the palace, art museums, shopping and restaurants.
