The noise level is loud all night, but a pair of ear plugs took care of that. The desk staff is very efficient but not overly friendly - they were helpful with directions and gave good service. I was allowed to check in as soon as I showed up - despite the fact that it was only 9am. The restaurant food in the hotal was very good but make sure you check your bill and your change as they tend to make huge mistakes in their favor. Again, the wait staff is efficient but not warm. The rooms are clean and, depending on which side of the building you're on, some are more quiet than others, but the spirit of the city will be heard throughout the night with people singing and bands playing outside the window. Be sure to walk across the piazza and take a picture on the spot that marks the geographical center of Spain. This is a wonderful area. If you can figure out the subway system, you can save a lot of money. It costs about $60 to $75 just to get to the airport from the hotel. The subway is a couple of Euro. Try to walk everywhere as the cab drivers will always try to rip you off. The rate for the room is very good considering that this is the perfect location in the middle of a European city.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location!”
Reviews.Author: nodan7
Reviews.Content: Clean with superb location! Priced right for this locale! Right at the square, right where you want to be! We asked for a room facing away from the square so noise was no problem. Good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Location can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: krugs
Reviews.Content: What a location! Just steps from the Puerta del Sol, one small block from El Corte Ingles and for the Real Madrid fan, across the street from their official store. (My sons loved that!) Wonderful location for seeing all the major sites of Madrid easily. The staff was helpful and the rooms were clean and basic. I was surprised how big the bathroom was. We had a family room which was three beds and plenty of space for 2 adults and 2 kids ages 11 and 8. We ate breakfast at the restaurant twice and their churros and chocolate was the best we had in Madrid. The only negative was the street noise. Ask for an inside room if you need sleep or have small kids because it can get loud.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Europa is a good as advertised.”
Reviews.Author: Paul14
Reviews.Content: Yes, this hotel has it all.....perfect location, wonderful & helpful staff, great rooms, excellent restaurant & bar.....we couldn't have asked for anything more. The free Internet was a blessing as this was our last stop. The hotel arranged our ride to the aiport via a private van...much cheaper than a taxi and at a set price...very important as we found the taxi drivers to be quite dishonest. LOVED the Europa!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Hotel Europa!”
Reviews.Author: jjohnson01
Reviews.Content: Our family chose Hotel Europa because of the Rick Steves' travel guide. It fit our every need. We were a family of five with an 11 year old and two 20 something daughters. The kids had a room with three beds and my husband and I had a room with two beds. Our rooms were on the second floor overlooking Calle Carmen and the Puerta del Sol. We loved watching the city life from our small balcony. Take ear plugs, because despite their heavy noise-filtering windows, the street noise could still be a problem. With ear plugs we all slept well. The restaurant food was excellent, the side-walk cafe charming, the waiters excellent, and everyone was friendly. We used the comfortable lobby as a sort of family room while we used the free internet/computers. Javi and Jim always pointed us in the right direction for restaurants and travel details. We bought groceries in El Corte Ingles grocery store (1 block away) to have breakfast and fruit/snacks in the room. Great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here twice on same trip - great location and staff!”
Reviews.Author: oregongirl2005
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a tour group, then on my own at the end of my trip. Excellent location right off Puerta del Sol. Lovely desk staff, always quite helpful especially with taxi arrangements, although you MUST leave your key card coming and going (they claim it's something about de-magnetizing...but really I think they just want to know who is coming and going). Nice, clean, comfortable rooms, very quiet considering the location (I had both a street facing room and interior room, both equally quiet). No breakfast included, but you can eat at the restaurant attached to the hotel or any number of other spots near by. If you're taking the metro, use the Calle del Carmen exit or else you'll take an extra long walk. Free computer access in lobby along with free wifi (ask for code at front desk). Make sure to get a pastry at La Mallorquina (on Puerta del Sol) - I'm still dreaming about them.

Reviews.Title: “Basic room, great location”
Reviews.Author: marytwhite
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great central location. It is very clean and the front desk staff quite cordial. The room was very basic and lacked charm, but we were only in Madrid for one night and needed a decent place to sleep. This hotel accomplished that. You can walk to everything from it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and unbeatable location!!!”
Reviews.Author: Boilermaker123
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel with big rooms. It was a great value. Scince it is located at puerta del sol, it could be a little noisy, but you can pay a lot more money for other hotels and still have some noise problems (read other Madrid hotels reviews). For us noise was not an issue. The metro station is right there so it is very convenient when doing day trips. If we go to Madrid again we will definately stay there again. the only thing I don't like is that they charge for the safe box and for the use of the printer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location--Superb Staff”
Reviews.Author: snowman52
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night in late May. The front desk staff was able to get us into a room by 1000, which was a life saver after an overnight flight from DC. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for city lovers”
Reviews.Author: coral082
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the centre of Madrid, seconds from all shops and metro. You can ask for a quiet room and would not hear any noise, and walk out right to all cafes and shops. You can walk from there to the palace and all attractions. The hotel also has his own cafe so you do not need to find a place to eat after a long day of walking and all other places are whithin short distance. The hotel is very clean, the rooms are very pleasant and the bathroom quite big and clean. The staff are helpfull and most of them speak English, very useful as most people I have met can't speak Englsih or French or German. All in all, this is a good choice especially for city lovers who do not want to waste hours travelling in the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: SFTraveler031
Reviews.Content: I don't understand how this wonderful place could be a 1 Star, it's easily a 3. Excellent front desk staff, great location, clean, comfortable rooms. Although I booked a room with a view/balcony of the Puerta del Sol, after one night (the night of the Munich/Milan soccer game - what timing) we asked to be moved to an interior room, and ended up with a smaller but quieter room and couldn't have been happier. If the windows had been better sound proofed we'd have loved the original room, but it was just too loud the entire night. The hotel is convenient to just about everything, and we walked all over Madrid. The Sol metro stop is around the corner from the hotel. The cafe is great for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jossie07
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for three nights in May and really enjoyed it. The location is the best to visit the wonderful city of Madrid; by the Puerta de Sol (also a metro station). You can easily walked to all the sites. The room was really nice probably upgraded recently. We had an interior room so it was very quiet at night. I'd definitely stay in this hotel again in the future. Just a note, never ate in the hotel restaurant/cafe but it was always packed. Also, there is free internet in the lobby. For a breakfast/snack place near by, I highly recommend La Mallorquina, right there in Puerta del Sol.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: Caminetto_Ocra
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights in this hotel, it's in a perfect location right in city centre. Clean and quiet rooms despite it's facing Puerta del Sol.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: PoojaV
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for three nights in May 2010. The hotel is a perfect location as it is the center of all the activities, shopping, and things you would need during the stay. The hotel staff is very polite, they were helpful and speak english well. The rooms are clean, shower was great, clean bedsheets. I can see why people would think its noisy, but for us it was fine! We chose this to be in the center of it all - so you can't expect quite when the Plaza is so busy. There was wired internet connection in the room - bring your own ethernet cable and laptop and you will be all set.

Reviews.Title: “#1 Location in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: The_Florda_Lovebirds
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff is extremely helpful and fluent in English. The hotel is spotlessly clean. Beds are comfortable. Veiw from the room is AMAZING (see the pictures!)!!!! The location is INCREDIBLE, it alone is worth the room rate. You are in the middle of ALL the action!!!!! The outside "cafe" is great for people watching and there are SO MANY people to watch at Puerta Del Sol!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: BusterBrewsky
Reviews.Content: Just spent three nights at Hotel Europa. Our first trip to Madrid. The hotel is great quality at a great price in the heart of Madrid next to the Plaza del Sol. The main door to the hotel is on Calle Carmen, a street only for walking...no cars. We had a room for three which was very large. Two twin beds and one queen/full size. The bathroom was large and well appointed. The staff was very accommodating and helpful. Each day when we returned the room was cleaned very well. The floors are wood laminate and the bath is marble which helps keep the room feeling clean and comfortable. The beds were comfortable. The staff was very helpful with ideas and recommendations. Our room was on the third floor overlooking Calle Carmen. We had two balconies. The only draw back, is the noise from the street can invade the room. Saturday night was a large festival so people were out to the wee hours of the morning and when groups passed, especially larger groups of young people, the shouting and noise could be heard. My family and I are fairly heavy sleepers so this really wasn't much of a problem but if we could hear it, any light sleeper could find this a problem. Again, we were on the lower floors so I would not let that dissuade you from staying. Request an inside room or a room on an upper floor. For the price and location however, this was a very good experience.....and we tend to be picky about the hotels we stay at. The cafe, Hotel Europa was also good for breakfast or a quick snack and the outdoor cafe was good for people watching. Internet was available in the lobby. Wi-Fi would be a nice addition. A 2 euro a day charge was added to the bill for the use of the safe. It would seem they would work that into their price and not nickel and dime the customers. Finally, the hotel requires guests to turn in their room key card when they leave for the day and it is handed back when you arrive later. This seemed to be an odd practice but we put our valuables in the safe just to be sure. I actually don't know how many stars this hotel has but I would rate it a very solid and good 3 stars approching 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Europa - great location, helpful staff, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: EThorntonAlbanyNYUSA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Europa with our two teenage daughters for one week in May. We were able to get two single rooms connected as a 'suite', which was perfect for our family. The hotel staff spoke English fluently and were extremely helpful, instructing us how to use the subway (very close to the hotel) and even helping procure tickets to a sold-out bullfight. The hotel restaurant food was good family fare and the restaurant was open late. The option of eating right at the hotel was invaluable on a couple of evenings when we returned late from sight-seeing. The rooms were very clean and spacious, with enough amenities to be comfortable. The hotel was also located in an area with an amazing number of stores and restaurants within easy walking distance and was also an easy walk to the Prado and Royal Palace. I would definitely recommend the Hotel Europa and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel !”
Reviews.Author: trebor9
Reviews.Content: The hotel is one of the better hotels that I have stayed at in Europe. The hotel is SPOTLESS and the rooms are good sized. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful and English is no problem. The location is great with a many good restaurants in the immediate area. Free internet is also a plus. This hotel is a great value.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this Hotel- staff made us feel so welcome!”
Reviews.Author: lmrsar
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were amazing, so helpful. We had a triple room for three nights, very roomy. Enjoyed the great location and the restaurant next door so convienient. Fun to people watch from the outdoor cafe. We would certainly return!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, really nice veiw”
Reviews.Author: HelmutSchnitzel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in March in a room over looking the square. I thought the location was great. I know some people complained about the noise but we were on the top floor and didn't hear anything. We even had the french doors open at night and were fine. That being said years of living in Manhattan make sleeping through noise rather easy. I also found the hotel, much like so many other things in Spain to be very well priced. The staff was great, very friendly and helpful. You had to pay for the safe, 2 euros a night, which was a little wierd but worth the piece of mind. The square in front is horribly touristy but all the major sights are within walking distance. Seems like people were out all night long even during the week and walking home from dinner at 2am didn't feel unsafe at all. Stay off the major squares when you're eating, hit the side streets instead for all the tapas places.

Reviews.Title: “You could do a lot worse....”
Reviews.Author: GaribaldiMalta
Reviews.Content: Quite a nice hotel in an unbeatable location right at the heart of Madrid. And therein lies the catch. It can get noisy especially during the night. Nothing too dramatic but if you are a light sleeper I suggest you either take earplugs or give this one a miss. Otherwise spotless, nice furnishings ample room and courteous staff. Other minor niggles which might annoy are :safe not free, no wifi available, and breakfast relatively expensive. These are things which in a hotel of this calibre should be rectified.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Tallygirl79
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and enjoyed our accommodations. While the hotel room was very plainly decorated, it was clean and much roomier than we expected. The bathroom was also much larger than most hotels. The staff was very helpful. There are two computers with free Internet access which came in handy to us. Location is great. You are right in the middle of town with a metro station just steps away. We'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I highly recommend this hotel because of its great location and pleasant staff.”
Reviews.Author: GrandmaAudrey
Reviews.Content: We recently spent five nights at the Hotel Europa. Its location on the Puerta del Sol is perfect and within easy walking distance of all the central Madrid attractions. The rooms are small but very clean. We had a room overlooking the Puerta del Sol and were not at all disturbed by any noise from the plaza about which other reviewers have complained. The shutters on the windows completely blocked any noise. The personnel at the front desk and the waiters in the adjoining restaurant were very nice and helpful. I would also like to recommend the tapas tour by Adventurous Appetites and the day tour of Avila and Segovia conducted by Viator. The tapas tour leaves from the Puerta del Sol and lasts approximately four hours. It can be booked in advance through www.adventurousappetites.com. Tours to Toledo and Avila/Segovia can also be booked in advance through www.viator.com. They leave from the Plaza de Espana.

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice”
Reviews.Author: FMRey
Reviews.Content: In the very heart of the city (Puerta del Sol) fun, well priced and recently renovated

Reviews.Title: “Best location...no doubt”
Reviews.Author: jetsetMar
Reviews.Content: Okay I am telling right now that if I ever return to Madrid…I am staying at this hotel again with no doubt. I traveled here on my own to celebrate New Years and the hotel staff made it even more special for me. They upgraded me to a room with balcony which I was able to see all the festivities from my balcony. Their rate for single was very reasonable. The room was super clean and comfortable. The bathroom was huge with Jacuzzi tub. The location was perfect too and I was able to walk every where – basically the epicenter of Madrid – Puerta del Sol. El Cortes Ingles is literally right across the street. Staff was super friendly and helped me with the purchase of tour tickets and restaurant recommendations. There is a cafeteria connected to the hotel which was super convenient to grab café con leche and sandwich mixto right before a tour. Overall, I would stay here again and highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Beat Location”
Reviews.Author: FBIAgent
Reviews.Content: The only hotel on Puerta del Sol...steps from the Metro...100 meters from El Corte Ingles department store...what else could you ask for location wise? Hotel Europa is a very clean hotel with spotless public areas, clean rooms and spacious bathroom, which are three critical factors when I choose hotels. If only the bed was more comfortable, I would have given it a full five points. If you are a light sleeper, you may want an inside room facing the courtyard. Otherwise, take advantage of the great views of Puerto del Sol and get an outside view room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff, Large Rooms”
Reviews.Author: 7WooHoos
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Europa in January for 3 nights. The staff is great and very accomodating. We had several rooms and our reservations changed several times due to airline difficulties.The staff kept up with all the changes and kept in touch with us prior to our visit and during our visit. The location can't get any better. We took the train into Madrid and then changed to the metro. There's a metro stop right in front of the hotel. Getting to the airport is a little more difficult on the metro, but unless you're travelling with a lot of luggage, it's worth changing trains for. The shuttle service from the hotel to the airport would have cost us 45e for our group of 7 and would have taken an hour. On the metro the cost was 1 euro each, although oneof our group was pickpocketed going to the airport on the metro....The hotel is within walking distance to almost everything you would want to do. There are countless restaurants and shops right outside the door. There's an El Corte Ingles one block away. The rooms are large, with large modern bathrooms. The rooms on the plaza were a little noisy sometimes, but not a problem. If you're a light sleeper ask for a room on the inside...you don't get the view, but it's quiet! They also have two computers in lobby that you can use for free.

Reviews.Title: “I absolutely love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CaitlynCailtyn
Reviews.Content: I could not have hoped for a better hotel. It's location was AMAZING. It was a little noisy at night but other than that I loved it. The staff was so kind and understanding when we were pick-pocketed!

Reviews.Title: “Location, confortable..”
Reviews.Author: realsleazydream
Reviews.Content: Very nice, confortable, central hotel!!We stayed in a Triple room very large overlooking the movida of the street!!!!! Liked vwry much

Reviews.Title: “Better and better.”
Reviews.Author: NJ_Mike_2009
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at Hotel Europa and each time it seems better. Of course the location is superb. My room was very quiet, impeccably clean as usual, priced fairly, and the staff were friendly and very helpful. I will use the hotel the next time I am in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: marcathy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights while in Madrid. More modern than the other hotels I stayed at in Spain, but the room was very clean, they have a great outdoor cafe in front with an inside restaurant which was very good. Hotel staff was very helpful, spoke impeccable English. It's right on the Porta del Sol which makes it an easy walk to the Prado or the Palace, but also could be noisy. We had a room on the outside, but they must have had triple paned glass because with the windows shut the noise wasn't bad, and being on their 42nd Street this could have been a real problem, but wasn't.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel near hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Advisoreader
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our trip to Spain. The Hotel Europa was a fine choice. We stayed there at the beginning and end of our Spain travels so we had both an inner courtyard room and street side room. Both were quiet and pleasant with exceptional bathrooms. The street side windows gave a delightful view of the happenings below without the accompanying noise. Other reviews have discussed the central location, but I would like to add the convenience of the nearby department store, El Corte Ingles, with its huge supermarket on the lower level. What a surprise. The selection of foods suitable for takeout was great. On a longer trip, it seems that a break from restaurant fare is really a welcome and/or necessary change!

Reviews.Title: “Central location can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: Worldtowander
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 days. Hotel is charming and the staff is friendly/helpful. The cafe is attached which serves food provides both indoor and outdoor seating which allows for the opportunity to people watch. Aside from current construction on Puerta del Sol near hotel, the location is great. The metro is within a few feet from hotel. There are lots of choices for shops and restaurants near by.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location. Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SDSpartan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Europa based on TA reviews and were not at all disappointed. The location is actually right off the Puerto del Sol - excellent and central location. We walked everywhere. The room was large, clean and modern. We had a double terrace overlooking the plaza - it was amazing and the french doors once closed actually were great blocking off any noise. Incredible. The beds were nice and comfortable. There was a large closet and safe in the room. The bathroom was modern, large, marble/tile. The tub/shower combo was good - great pressure and hot water. I would stay here again without hesitation. The staff was great and pleasant to deal with. 2 free internet computers in the lobby. There is parking close by for about $20 Euros per day - a bit pricey but convenient. The street in front of the hotel is a pedistrian only walkway. There is a restaurant and cafe/bar next door - great for people watching. We ended our night there.

Reviews.Title: “This is the best hotel we had in a month travelling in Spain.”
Reviews.Author: Diane011
Reviews.Content: We were so happy we chose this hotel for our 4 nights in Madrid. The location, right on the Puerta Del Sol, is so central to everything we wanted to see. Most within walking distance, and the Tourist Hop on/off bus stops in the corner of plaza. There is even an elevator to the metro that gets you to the RENFE station for 1.20 euros. We had a room with a balcony overlooking the plaza, and it was a wonderful place to people watch, with the shutters closed it was quiet at night. The staff were so friendly and helpful, and remembered us when we returned 3 weeks later for our last night. The restaurant next door a great place for morning cafe or sandwich lunch. There are two computers available in the lobby for free. Will recommend this to anyone visiting Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “We were thrilled with Hotel Europa”
Reviews.Author: brianhh
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Europa for three nights to start our trip in Spain, and we loved it. The room was clean, the staff at the front desk were very nice and helpful, and the shower was great - adjustable height (I'm 6-3, so I always enjoy a hotel shower that doesn't force me to do the limbo to get my hair wet), good pressure, and hot. They have a couple of computers in the lobby on the internet, but no Wi-Fi. No breakfast, but the adjoining cafe/restaurant made it convenient to get a cup of cafe in the morning. We had dinner there one evening as well and it was quite good. The location was absolutely perfect. It's right in the heart of things, with shopping, restaurants, and tapas bars all around. We were able to walk everywhere - to the museums, the train station, Palacio Real, and Parc Retiro. There's a metro stop right in Puerta del Sol, but we only ended up using it once. I'd highly recommend Hotel Europa to anyone vacationing in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: SusyPhoto
Reviews.Content: Hotel Europa is right in the heart of Madrid, amidst tapas bars, restaurants, night life, and street life. It is only one block from a metro stop and one block from a train station stop. The staff is friendly and helpful, the rooms are spotless, and there is a good restaurant/cafeteria next door. You could not ask for a better location if you want to really experience Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Rooms, Friendly Staff, in the heart of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: EF7292
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here during our week long trip to Madrid. The hotel is centrally located on the Plaza del Sol. The rooms are bright,cheery, and quite spacious. All rooms are equiped with air conditioning and cable television, Our room also featured a newly remodeled bathroom and a balcony facing the Plaza. The hotel also operates a cafe that runs all day and offers outdoor seating on the Plaza del Sol. They offer a daily menu that ranges from 10 to 15 Euros and is a resonable dining option The staff here were extremely helpful, courteous, and all desk staff spoke fluent English. The housekeeping staff did an excellent job and the building and rooms were kept very clean. Overall I would say that this hotel was a great value and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find... Recommend, but it is a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: GMaria
Reviews.Content: I´m staying at this hotel right now and using the free computers in the lobby. We arrived 2 nights ago, and I have to say that we´re very pleased with this hotel. We did a LOT of research before deciding. The hotel we initially wanted (Hotel Acapulco) was full, so we got a room here. We´re seasoned travelers and picky with our hotel choices. We don´t go for expensive, luxury hotels (prefer to spend money eating well and drinking wine), but we definitely want clean and comfortable rooms and bathrooms. This hotel was recommended by Rick Steves, and he is right. The location couldn´t be better, right on Plaza del Sol and within walking distance to everything. Easy to start his recommended walking tours right from our hotel. Our room is on the 3rd floor and has 2 balconies (corner room). The room is large for european standards. The bathroom is completely remodeled, with marble floors-walls, clean shower-bath, with excellent water pressure. We have a fantastic view of the action down below, at the Plaza del Sol. We took the metro from the airport (cheap & easy), changing lines 2 times. The metro stop is a few steps away from the hotel. Just be aware that right now the Plaza is undergoing renovations, so we woke up to the sound of the jackhammers. Of course, it was 1pm. The windows are thick preventing most of the people-street noise, but I suppose you could get a room not facing the Plaza but the side street if you want to have a bit more quiet. We´ve slept fine at night, but for those with sensitive ears it might be a bit noisy (people) at night. There are people walking the streets past midnight. The streets around the hotel are all pedestrian, including the Plaza, of course, so there is no traffic noise. There is free wi-fi in the lobby (great for Skype users) and free internet in the room, if you bring your own ethernet cable (otherwise, you have to rent the cable at 2 euros per day). There is a cafeteria-restaurant next door, with great lunch specials (11 euros, 3-courses with dessert & drink). The staff is very helpful and pleasant, so far. All of the guys at the reception speak English. At 98 euros per night, including tax, great location, super clean, and friendly staff, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Recently renovated in a great location...”
Reviews.Author: gdmyers
Reviews.Content: Located right on the Puerta del Sol. If you get an outside room on Thursday through Saturday you will be bothered by the street noise. No way around it. However, this hotel has a great location, with a terrace/patio restaurant that's popular with the locals too...Wired internet in the rooms, wireless in the lobby with two free desktop PC's available in the lobby as well. Bright, clean and recently renovated. Listed as $$ approx 100 euros for a double. Great value considering the location and a Metro stop right outside the door. No breakfast buffet, but lots of options for breakfast just outside the door. My room was on the smallish side, but your only sleeping and showering anyway. Front desk speaks good English.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to beat for the price”
Reviews.Author: baringlake
Reviews.Content: Located right in the Puerta del Sol, just a couple of blocks from the Plaza Mayor and next to the metro system. Our room had a balcony, and the bathroom was large. Staff was helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice- but VERY dishonest!!”
Reviews.Author: Hfikvxh
Reviews.Content: We checked our bags with the hotel as we arrived early. We returned and our bags were stolen by the staff. Our laptop, camera, etc. $2200.00! We had to fight them for a month to get a re-imbersment. Advice: be very careful!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel,perfect location clean ,quiet and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: lmltraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights. This hotel is right off the Plaza del Sol. Even with the construcion of rebuilding the plaza(jack hammers etc). Our room was so quiet you never heard what was going on outside your window. The staff was friendly and helpful and spoke great English. Rooms were cool ,clean and comfy. The restaurant connected to the hotel had fresh croisants and pastry for breakfast and was convienient and friendly service. I would definately stay here again. Also at 90 something Euros a night a real bargain in a big city!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel / Unique Quad Room/especially for Family with teenagers”
Reviews.Author: AmericanTraveler22
Reviews.Content: We often stay in luxury hotels in the US like Ritz Carlton's. This was not at that level but it was comparable to a very nice Marriott. You dont find many nice hotels having "quad rooms" that can accomadate four people. Its in a great location walking distance to all the great and beautiful sites in central Madrid. Its on a very lively square and the new windows made the room silent at night. The room was very large (about 15x18 feet) and cheerful with high Europen windows with a nice sized bathroom. It had two large beds for the four of us ( 2 adults and two teens). There was a great supermarket close by. The public spaces are very nice. The front desk staff were cordial and helpful but a bit uncheerful ( this seemed to be a Madrid or cultural thing). The price @155E/night was great. The quad room saved us a lot of money. Overall "A" grade. Wed go back in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Great price!”
Reviews.Author: sanlarsson
Reviews.Content: Puerto del Sol is under construction so you should be able to get a really good rate but the location and the quality, in the heart of Madrid, can't be beat and believe me I've tried on other trips to Madrid. Get an interior room if you want it quiet or are time-changing. Cafe is a great place to start your day while you people watch and the staff were always helpful.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful, great location, clean, everyone spoke great english”
Reviews.Author: stanleyer
Reviews.Content: Hotel Europa was justifiably recommended by Rick Steves in his guide book about Spain. It was in a great location, if you are interested in seeing things, shopping, and people watching. Our rooms were on the interior court so they were super quiet even thought the crowds were huge outside.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: harnackj
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Great value for the price. The staff was extremely helpful and very friendly. The rooms are clean and comfortable, although they are not large. The beds are comfortable and we slept well. The location is the probably the greatest asset. Right on the Puerta del Sol and within walking distance to Retiro, Plaza Mayor, Prado, and the Chueca distict. It can be noisy there, but we didn't have any problems and our room overlooked the street. The attached cafe has excellent food. If you want a break from restaurant food, Corte Ingles is just down the street. The bottom floor is a very nice supermarket. You can pick up some bread, cheese and fruit for an inexpensive meal. The metro station right there. If you fly in, save yourself 35 euro and take the underground.

Reviews.Title: “Regular”
Reviews.Author: quintopino
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a couple of nights here in February 09. The location's great right on Puerto del Sol, and I had an interior patio room which was quiet, but it was very small (OK it was a single, but still..), it covered the bases - and not a penny more. It's a functional, well-located hotel, and if you're going to be out most of the time (and if you're in Madrid, let's face it, you will be) then it's fine for passing out and waking up, but that's pretty much it it. But OK all in all.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Austriangypsy
Reviews.Content: We had a beautiful balcony room overlooking the pedestrian zone. (When the windows are closed, you cannot hear the noise below) It was very clean, airy,and has good beds. Fabulous location. I traveled with my sister and my niece and we felt safe walking at all hours of the night. The front desk staff is the best I have ever encountered. My niece and I are both Flight Attendants and travel extensively so that statement is huge coming from us. It was our first time in Spain. Our Spanish is very poor. Thankfully, Jamie spoke perfect English. He made suggestions for restaurants, entertainment, helped with transportation and was able to answer our every question. The entire staff was very nice to us. The hotel is very clean. They also have free computers to use which is important to us. We also enjoyed the Cafe connected to the hotel. Great place to people watch and has a large menu. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Sunny and pleasant in great location”
Reviews.Author: Samcat1
Reviews.Content: When I vacation I walk everywhere and the Hotel Europa was a perfect choice for me. It's in the heart of everything, right on Puerto del Sol which is unfortunately under construction and behind ugly blue temporary walls. Major streets radiate from Puerto del Sol to every corner of the city and there's a subway stop steps away from Hotel Europa if you're inclined to ride (which I did to the airport for 2E). Less than 5 minutes on foot there's a wide variety of restaurants and stores including Cortes Ingles which has a food market in its lowest level if you opt to picnic. Front desk very friendly when I checked in. The man who took my bags up to my room was especially friendly, warm and welcoming. Later in my visit I had questions and the front desk was busy, and while they answered my questions, well, let's say they're not the best multi-taskers. Comment based on earlier review on this site: I kept my keycard with me even even though they ask you to turn it in for them to keep and no one said a word. Two free computers in the lobby were available most times I wanted them and most guests were respectful of the 15 minute time limit per-use time request. Room comfortable and clean; bigger than most in Europe for the price. I left for breakfast at 8 am and upon return, my room was made up. Bathroom modern, large and sparkling. When I reserved I asked for, and got, a non-smoking interior room which had French doors opening to a courtyard. Nice and quiet. Geraniums bloomed in window boxes outside every room.. Courtyard had plastic roof that let in a lot of sun; when it rained I opened the doors for a cool breeze and nothing inside got wet. I ate breakfast at the attached restaurant; waiters were friendly and tolerant of my horrendous attempts at Spanish. I spent time reading at my table and was never rushed. There are non-smoking tables inside immediately to left as you enter restaurant's front doors. I'm a solo traveler and conscious about security. Even though I saw a lot of action buzzing around outside, I always felt safe. Muzak playing "The Christmas Song" in June a bit quirky -- it really endeared me to the place.

Reviews.Title: “great location, rather popular with RS crowd, and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: WageandBabo
Reviews.Content: Diagonal across the corner is a Zara. There's a computer kiosk in the main lobby. Lot of people staying at hotel that are not with the tour group but with the Rick Steve tourbook crowd (it must be highly rated), but the best thing about this hotel is its location: it's right near a major metro station and close to shops and shopping/restaurant and near the center of Madrid, so everything is within walking distance. A band plays out at night in front of the hotel (there is a hotel restaurant attached) so it can be really noisy on the street in front but the windows are double paned (we had french doors) so the soundproofing is alright. Fun to watch the band from the windows if you get a room in the front. Room is roomy by european standards; bathroom was quite nice. There is a step out front that you should be careful- we saw a guest trip on it and twist her ankle; there isn't any sign to tell you to pay attention and watch where you walk. One of the receptionists kept laughing at me and my roommate: I guess our spanish was hilarious (we tried to use castilian even, and tried to lisp) so he would laugh every time he saw us walk back in and ask for our keycard. (You don't take it with you- they ask that you leave it in the desk so you don't lose it.) This might annoy some people, but we did not notice any security issue.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Price-Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: letstravelwithtwins
Reviews.Content: Just back from Madrid and Hotel Europa on our family vacation with our 10 year old twins. This type of hotel is just perfect for how we travel. The location was excellent. Near restaurants, shops, metros, grocery store, etc. Walking distance to many of Madrid’s famous sites. Felt very safe. Staff was friendly and helpful. Hotel is centrally located on a pedestrian square (see photos from out our balcony) but quiet with double paned glass in windows. Has A/C and a safe (2E/day). Clean, comfortable. Hotel totally filled with Americans. Did have 2 nights were some “college-aged” Americans were running through the halls of the hotel at 3AM singing and screaming though. Did not last long or I would have called the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Boytbab
Reviews.Content: Hotel is centrally located and had a busy feel to it. Very open and light. Rooms very clean, especially the bathroom. No frills but a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the middle of things and yet quiet and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Texas-Vagabond
Reviews.Content: Hotel Europa was the first 5 nights of our 2 week vacation and we used it as a base for touring Madrid as well as day trips to Segovia and Toledo. The hotel was incredibly clean and the staff were very friendly and helpful. This hotel has about 100 rooms, but has the feel of a place that is about 40 rooms. It sits right off the Plaza del Sol which is an easy spot to catch the Metro, taxi, or city tourbus. Rooms are very up to date and good size. We asked for a quiet room and had no complaints. Bathroom is also very large and entirely marble. In a city where rooms can get pretty expensive this is a very good value. The restaurant downstairs is really convenient, offers a good breakfast, and all other meals. It may not be the best in Madrid, but sure comes in handy when you've had a long day and just want some good food without traveling far to get it. Restaurant staff are also friendly and fun. In the evening they put out what seems like 100 tables on the sidewalk for enjoying tapas, cocktails and people watching. The very busy pedestrian walkway outside the hotel is right in the middle of lots of shopping and restaurants. We found the 20 minute walk to El Palacio Real to be easy.

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Woody2008
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on the recommendation from one of those popular travel books and followed it up with the reviews here on TripAdvisor. I concur with the reviews reported here that it is a great location and value. The rooms are clean, the staff is helpful, access to the internet is nice and Cafe Europa is a great place to end the night. We did not have breakfast include and usually made our way around the block to La Mallorquina for some pastries and coffee to start the day. My only warning would be if you are a light sleeper the first floor room facing Calle de Carmen can get a little noisy during the night.

Reviews.Title: “great location, nice big room, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: swisstourist
Reviews.Content: This hotel was right next to the Puerta del Sol and close to metro stops in the middle of Madrid. The room I had was very large for European standards and so was the bathroom. I didn't have a view, but that was ok as I heard that rooms that overlooked the street or plaza were very very noisy. The staff was friendly and helpful and even helped with arranging transportation on the shuttle to the airport. There is a department store right nearby. The breakfast wasn't too great - not much choice. **The air conditioning is central air and doesn't go on until May 1. Problem if it gets hot before that day. Free internet in the lobby (two computers) which is a big plus. The only annoying this is you are supposed to turn in your key each time you leave the hotel - I personally don't think it's very safe - how are they supposed to remember who has what room

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at Hotel Europa times two”
Reviews.Author: dmelovetravel
Reviews.Content: My sister and I treated our mother to a trip to Spain. We spent the first three nights of our trip at Hotel Europa and then returned there for our last night in Spain. Both stays were outstanding. The rooms are average sized by European standards, however, they are very clean and neatly appointed. The staff was always helpful. There is a cafeteria at the hotel and not only was their food and sangria good, but the staff there was friendly and funny. Best of all, Hotel Europa is located at Puerta del Sol, which is really the starting point to any journey in Madrid. The metro, Sol station, is a very short walk from the hotel. Hotel Europa is an unbelievable value . I will definitely stay there when I return to Madrid and hopefully that will be soon.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: Besttime
Reviews.Content: Overall modern, clean and light hotel in an unbeatable location - This was our last stop after two weeks touring France and Spain, and we were very pleasantly surprised at the excellent overall quality and service of this hotel. Without hesitation we highly recommend it !

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location! Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wolves83
Reviews.Content: We travelled for a long weekend in Madrid and this hotel is perfectly placed to do that! Service was great, they even carried our bags up to our rooms for us on arrival. Rooms were large and clean. Only thing I would point out is that they are currently doing some building work around Sol, so our room normally would have looked out onto the beautiful square, however it actually had a sheet over the front of the hotel - so no view. However the windows did manage to more or less block out the noise, so it was fine. I would definitely go back there if i return to Madrid and I loved Madrid so no doubt I will!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Europa: Haven in a bustling city.”
Reviews.Author: redi4sun
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Europa with our two children recently, and would highly recommend it. We had a clean bright room (Quad) with a small balcony. The staff was extremely professional and helpful and the location cannot be beat. All attractions were within walking distance of the hotel, which in is the pedestrian zone of Puerta del Sol. The hotel has an attached restaurant and cafe. We enjoyed taking a break in the afternoon at the cafe...

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of Madrid, no better place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: IHeartSpain
Reviews.Content: We checked in with ease, and rusty Spanish to find out the host spoke perfect English (with a beautiful accent). It was nice to have someone greet us with a smile and help us to our room with our bags. We settled in quickly and were back out the door to experience Madrid, with the Plaza Mayor within walking distance, the major shopping district, and even a nice walk to the Royal Palace, Plaza Oriente and the Prado Museum; though that is the beauty of this city, everything is within walking distance. I LOVE IT!

Reviews.Title: “Fairly priced luxury”
Reviews.Author: trademybike
Reviews.Content: A double room for €100/night in late April in the heart of Madrid at Puerta del Sol sounds pretty perfect to me. As the first stop on our vacation, Hotel Europa was a place we could look forward to going home to at the end of every long day. The double rooms come with two decent sized beds, a desk and chair (though a little cramped to actually sit in), a television mounted on the wall, and a terrace overlooking Puerta del Sol (at least ours did!). The bathroom was marvelous! Tub/shower combo, lots of room to change/move. Overall, a very nice accommodation. The clerks at the front desk were extremely friendly. I don't know if it's protocol, but after 19 hours of airports and airplanes, it was a welcomed sight to have the clerk take us to our room, insisting on carrying our bags for us the whole way. There is a little cafe/bar attached to Hotel Europa. The breakfasts are all right, nothing super fantastic, but if you're looking for a convenient bite with friendly staff, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great room, great price”
Reviews.Author: jm58
Reviews.Content: A boutique hotel in a wonderful location with a great room and a terrific price - an excellent introduction to Madrid and its sights. The Room was relatively spacious with many amenities, and the staff were attentive and helpful. Would stay there again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Best Location!!”
Reviews.Author: JYA6768
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel right in the center of Sol. The rooms are small, but well kept and the bathrooms have full-sized tubs. We stayed here on two different occasions a week apart. On our first stay we had a room on the 4th floor with a great view of the plaza below. On our second stay our room was on the 3rd floor facing an inner courtyard. Something was wrong with the thermostat and the room became very hot during the night. We didn't open the window because there was some type of mechanical noise which we would occasionally hear from the courtyard. I would stay here again because of the great location, but would request the 4th floor room with balcony!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location and clean, quiet rooms”
Reviews.Author: Veg_Philly
Reviews.Content: This is absolutely smack in the center of Madrid. I don't know a better location for the tourist. You can walk to the Palacio Real, all the art museums, and many great restaurants, as well as a Turkish bath (very close) and a movie theater (a tad farther) if you're in the mood. The hotel itself is clean, modern, and basic. We asked for an interior room to avoid noise from the Puerta del Sol, and the room was, indeed, very quiet. (I don't know if the exterior rooms are noisy or not; I just anticipated that they might be, and asked for an interior room.) The room was clean, but small. We were very comfortable there, though the "king" bed was not one; rather, it was two twins pushed together. This seems to be very common in Spain, though it wasn't ideal for our honeymoon. (The mattresses are in no way one unit; in fact, they are made separately with separate sheets.) Otherwise, the hotel was great. The only other minor annoyance was the hotel policy to leave keys at the front desk when going out; it never created a problem, as the front desk is staffed 24/7, but it was mildly annoying on days when we made multiple trips in and out, having to stop at the desk each time. Oh, and finally, the free internet access in the lobby was useful. We didn't have that when we moved on to Barcelona (where we stayed in an inferior hotel), and missed it.

Reviews.Title: “Great sized Rooms”
Reviews.Author: travelnutUSA
Reviews.Content: Loved the Europa. Great location, very large, clean rooms. Good service. Nice cafe next door. We were very impressed and would stay their again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and friendly a real value”
Reviews.Author: miamimango
Reviews.Content: Started our Spain trip at Hotel Europa in Madrid. Location was perfect. We had a room on the 3rd floor with a small balcony looking down on the Puerta del Sol. The entertainment in the square below was as enjoyable as anything. Protestors, street performers, etc. was a great peak into life in this city, noise not too bad at night, but if it bothers you request a room off the square. We could walk to all major sites, Prado, Palace, etc and train station for a day trip to Toledo. Room was clean and front desk staff helpful. 2 Computers in lobby were free and great for confirming the rest of our trip once we arrived.

Reviews.Title: “lovely modern hotel, central location”
Reviews.Author: floridausawales
Reviews.Content: hotel excellent, refurbished to a high standard. Paid 155 euro per night stayed for 3 (shared between four that makes it more reasonable) no breakfast but available at an extra cost of 7 euro for basic continental. Location central but can be a little noisey early in the mornings Ok if the balcony doors are shut --did not put us off. Receptionist staff more than helpful, lovely street bar/restaurant adjoined to the hotel. Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for more”
Reviews.Author: Yatesie16
Reviews.Content: I visited Madrid on my hen weekend in July 2008 - there were 9 of us staying in 3 triple rooms. This hotel was a fantastic choice. It is situated right on Plaza del Sol and within very easy walking distance of Plaza Mayor and other central attractions. The rooms were spotless and the service fantastic. The staff were very helpful and friendly and went out of their way to make our stay as enjoyable as possible. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a good value, central base for a trip to Madrid. My husband and I will be staying there for 5 nights when we go to Madrid for a wedding later this year, I wouldn't consider staying anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “The most friendly and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Rescuefarm
Reviews.Content: We found ourselves coming back to the hotel cafe for excellent service and food. They have a LONG list of tapas made with fresh, excellent ingredients. The staff of the entire hotel and cafe were fun and happy and enjoyed chatting and giving directions and pointing out hot spots in Madrid. Our room was spacious and opened out onto a balcony right over Porta del Sol. They never sleep in Madrid so if you go to bed early, take ear plugs. If you like to live it up, you will not want to stay anywhere else. This hotel is in the center of everything and massive amounts of shops, restaurants, and night clubs are a block or two away at most. This is the most central and wonderful hotel in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “New Years 2009”
Reviews.Author: dmf379
Reviews.Content: Couldn't ask for a better location to stay for New Years. It was in the heart of the city right on Plasa del Sol we prepartied in our room and then walked out at 11pm and pushed our way into the crowds. The rooms were pretty standard nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: revja
Reviews.Content: This was a perfect choice, the location is perfect for visiting Madrid, it is within walking distance of most of the major sites, the sidewalk cafe is great for having a small meal and watching the city go by. The room was large especially by European standards and the staff was very friendly and helpful. For the cost and location this is a great hotel in Madrid and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Liked Central Location; true to Rick Steve's description...”
Reviews.Author: Xtup
Reviews.Content: Outstanding location and clean, serviceable rooms, and helpful staff. We also ate at the sidewalk cafe for breakfast, used the metro, went on the Rick Steve's walking tour, and went to Mass at the church up the street. Unfortunately, we had to go to the policy station as my BlackBerry was pickpocketed at the train station (while getting on to the metro underground with our luggage), and the hotel staff provided good directions and guidance for that adventure.

Reviews.Title: “The Only Place to Stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: fmpden
Reviews.Content: Cannot believe the transformation from an excellent to outstanding hotel in the core of Madrid. It was a great hotel eight years ago but the new remodeling has moved into a whole new category. Not sure why it is rated a three star when it is far better than some four stars that we have used. The rooms, the service, the enhanced restaurant next door, and even the new elevators are near perfect. We really liked the place.

Reviews.Title: “Really recommend this one”
Reviews.Author: Rose_of_York
Reviews.Content: Not easy to find a website to book this hotel, but it is worth perservering. Perfect location, comfortable rooms with smart bathrooms, friendly service

Reviews.Title: “Superb location”
Reviews.Author: gillianweatherburn
Reviews.Content: just returned from a weekend break . The hotel could not be faulted. The location is brilliant, being on one of the main squares with everything a ten minute walk away. So many bars and restaurants to choose from and most of them serving free tapas with your drinks. Sometimes so many we didnt need a meal. The hotel is really clean and well maintained, and the staff really helpful (a bit moody in the breakfast room) All in all a really good choice if you only have a couple of days and want to be able to walk easily to the main attractions. One thing we found. the cable car only runs on weekends at this time of year.

Reviews.Title: “Love it! Have stayed here 5 times already!”
Reviews.Author: Cannotwaittotravel
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times since 1997. The location is perfect, with excellent staff, and well appointed rooms. It was recently remodeled; the rooms are spotless with decent size bathrooms. If you don't enjoy Madrid's night life, ask for a room not facing Puerta del Sol or calle Carmen, those streets can be noisy. You will get a lot for your money! Enjoy your vacation to the fullest!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice!”
Reviews.Author: JazzGuitarist
Reviews.Content: My wife & I planned a trip to Spain about a year ago and use the Rick Steves book "Spain 2008" as a guide. (Don't visit Spain without reading this book prior). We book the Hotel Europa via the hotel web site and asked for a room on a top floor. Our arrival in Madrid (from Philadelphia) and trip via taxi was effortless and the taxi dropped us 5 feet from the front door. Upon arrival our bags were whisked out of the taxi and, as were were checking in early, the bags were stored securely until later in the day. We immediately booked a bus tour and returned to the hotel later in the afternoon. Our room was 'squeaky' clean and overlooked the plaza. The bed was very comfortable, the bathroom was a good size, and everything about the room satisfied weary travelers. (we made an excellent choice in booking Hotel Europa) NOTE: even the hallways were impressive; the rugs were spotless and the marble walls were something not seen in most American hotels ~ very nice. The front desk staff was very professional, efficient and courteous. Most of our questions were handled by 'Javier' who was very professional and assisted us in tour arrangements. We ate at the hotel sidewalk cafe and were most impressed. YOU"VE GOT TO EAT and drink HERE! A pitcher of sangria, a plate of ham & cheese, and of course the bread. Scrumptious! And the sidewalk musicians were great also. We had no difficulties with street noise even though our room overlooked the square; the windows (when closed) block out virtually all noise. The hotel location is center to many activities most tourists look for; shopping, restaurants, nightlife, access to tour busses, etc. Perfect! We rate Hotel Europa as one of the best, and inexpensive, hotels we've stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Great HOTEL GREAT VALUE”
Reviews.Author: sankaty10
Reviews.Content: We had a spacious room on the second floor facing Puerta del Sol. Loved the energy of the City first hand from the balcony. Staff were very friendly and not afraid to engage in light hearted conversation even with our broken Spanish. Clean comfortable bed and it seemed staff were cleaning constantly. Great central location and the restaurant on the terrace served great tapas and some of the hardest working efficient waiters we have ever witnessed. Sure they asked us to spare the towels if possible. that is fine with us especially in a country where a rainy day is a god send.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Europa”
Reviews.Author: KerryBabe
Reviews.Content: We could not believe our luck when we arrived at the Hotel Europa last week . We were met at the door by a friendly porter who promptly relieved us of our bags and deposited them in our room. The staff at the check-in desk were very efficent and friendly and have a multitude of languages . The room was usual European city size and was very comfortable with a large bathroom and had lovely french doors opening onto a little balcony. The hotel has a very popular restaurant and outside terrace , perfect for relaxing in the evening . Our room also had air conditioning which was much needed in 30 degree temperatures. Actually - check out the website - the rooms are very much as is on the pictures. Fantastic value for €90 per night for the room. The hotel itself has a perfect location. Right outside its door are shops like Mango & Zara and many other hight street stores & department stores. You're also no more than 5 mniutes walk from the main shopping street the Gran Via and less than a 10 minute walk to the main bar / restaurant area. Everything within Madrid is easily reached by walking. The hotel can also arrange the open top bus tour which I would highly recoommend to anyone visiting the city for only a few days. There is also free internet access in the foyer - there is a limit of 15mins per person tho.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent location, good value”
Reviews.Author: travel-andersen
Reviews.Content: This is a excelent hotel located as central as you can get it. The staff are friendly and the hotel is very clean. The rooms are not too big, but are very comfortable. To be a two star hotel and prized at €85 pr night, its very good value for the money

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: Canadian45
Reviews.Content: Great staff, great central location, great rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre hotel”
Reviews.Author: s5a5s5y
Reviews.Content: I read several good reviews of this hotel, but was a bit disappointed. Mediocre hotel and mediocre value for what you get. Yes, the location is central but almost too hectic. I would prefer a slightly quieter street. Rooms are sparse, nothing special, though clean. Really did not like towels - thin, old, scratchy - and barely provided any soap (picky perhaps, but that is something I notice). Staff is pleasant but nothing to make note of. Making reservation was very easy though. Would not recommend the restaurant. I read a good review so I had lunch there, but I do not recommend it. I probably would not stay here again nor would I recommend it. Instead I would either look for a lesser-priced but better value B&B, or I would just spend more for a nicer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Europa”
Reviews.Author: BeachiPichi
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three day visit to Madrid and stayed at Hotel Europa. This is our second stay at Europa and the first since its renovation two years ago. This hotel does not disappoint. Not only is it ideally located right smack in the middle of Puerta del Sol, but it is spotless and the staff is very helpful and friendly. One piece of advice—on our first trip we had a great room with a balcony overlooking the street; but we had a hard time sleeping because of noise that continued well into the wee hours. For this trip I booked an interior room and had no problems with noise. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone who is planning to visit Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Ants”
Reviews.Author: alwaystravellin
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at this hotel. The first visit during the winter (February) was perfect (we loved the spaciousness, the location and the price). In contrast, this time (July), we only stayed for one night, because in the morning, we saw little black ants in the bathroom and crawling across the floor. Ants are not the type of souvenir that I want to take home in my luggage. So, we left the hotel, but reported the problem to the desk clerks; sadly, they did not seem surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Location and price can't be beat!”
Reviews.Author: TucsonDesertwillow
Reviews.Content: Great hotel at a great price. Clean rooms, friendly staff and great views of the plaza from our balcony. Also the restaurant had some of the best food we had on the trip. Within walking distance to the Prado one direction and the Palace the other. Wish I could have stayed longer, Also 1 block away is the Dept store El Corte Ingles. Don't miss their wine and cheese.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: atty666
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in March 2008, the Location was fantastic, the staff were really helpfull, the rooms were clean, tidy and the service was great. If I went back to Madrid i would definatley stay here again. You will not be dissaponted with this hotel great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful hotel, great price!”
Reviews.Author: sw121
Reviews.Content: I choose this hotel after reading the other reviews on Trip Advisor and I was not disappointed. During our five night stay I had to keep reminding myself that yes I could afford a hotel with beautiful rooms, marble bathrooms and corridors, gorgeous stairways, wonderful views and right in the very centre of Madrid. We stayed in double room 221 - which was a corner room right on the Puerto Del Sol. Because it is a corner room we had two balconies, one of which was right over the Madrid Bear statue. I couldn't believe we were getting this standard of accommodation, in the centre of Madrid for £75 a night! The staff were helpful, there is a PC available in the reception area for internet access. This was often busy, but we just hopped on if it happened to be free as we were passing through. Pretty much everything we wanted to see in Madrid was within walking distance of this hotel. Plaza Mayor is only five minutes walk away (at a leisurely pace), the palace is around 10 minutes walk, Gran Via is about 5 mins, Plaze De Espana about 10 mins, Retiro Park is about 20 mins. The hotel is incredibly easy to find, you just take the Metro to Sol, go to the Calle de Carmen exit and look for the statue of the bear. The only negative thing I can think of is that night times could be very noisy, as street performers sometimes gather at the bear and can play until well past midnight - so it may not be right if you like early nights. Overall, a wonderful hotel, at an amazing price and in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: wbere
Reviews.Content: We (2 adults + 1 teenager) spent comfortable 3 nights in 4th floor room overlooking the Puerta del Sol in early June. We checked in early and room was already ready at 10 a.m., and when I requested a larger one, the front desk immediately concurred. Room was not big, by any means, maybe 300 feet? but plenty of room for a queen bed + twin. Nice view with small balcony, which was mostly quiet, but watch out for the drunks outside at 4 a.m. and the saxaphone player! The hotel was clean, well run, and the staff was friendly and helpful. Free internet in lobby. Great location. Cost of room: 120 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, but”
Reviews.Author: robertpol
Reviews.Content: Firstly, the hotel, in my experience, uses simply, the name, Hotel Europa, as opposed to Hotel Residencia Europa. This maybe significant as they are not listed with the usual booking sites. I believe it is privately owned and they apparently want to do their thing without involving fees or discounts to anyone. This however is NOT a drawback as their rates are well below the average. Like most reviewers, we found our six nights spent in a clean, modern hotel, well run and friendly. The bathroom in particular was new. Location is in the very center of Madrid, indeed, in the very center of Spain. Restaurants, shops, Metro, sights, museums are all within easy walking distance. The room came with cable TV and free Internet access via a cable (wireless and a laptop are also free in the lobby). Three things detracted from our comfort: We had a larger room facing the Puerta del Sol and noise was a problem from street musicians despite the soundproof (almost) glass windows. The music ends at 11 PM but be prepared to be serenaded until then. A smaller room facing away from the square would be the only remedy. The mattress on the bed was so hard and unsupportive we both had back pains each morning. Nothing chronic, they went away, but be aware. While there was more than enough space in our room, only straight backed desk chairs were provided. No sofa or easy chair were available at the end of a busy day. Aside from these caveats, it was a fine place to stay, the savings were considerable and we would return. http://hoteleuropa.es/index.en.html

Reviews.Title: “A great budget hotel in an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: SJCa
Reviews.Content: The enthusiastically glowing reviews of this hotel are well deserved. It is in a great location for playing tourist (the Metro Sol station is right next to the hotel) and it comes at a great price. Everyone I met at the front desk spoke excellent English and had a great attitude. I had a room with a balcony facing the Puerta del Sol plaza, so I was a little concerned about the noise. However, the windows had double-paned glass, and I usually could not hear the crowd noise above the air conditioner. The room had contemporary furnishings, and everything was clean and in good condition. The room had plenty of space. In addition to the internet available on a public computer in the lobby, my room had an ethernet connection. You need to have your own CAT5 cable. Somehow, I was not able to make this work, but I suspect that the problem was with my computer. I was told that wifi is available in the lobby, but I did not try it. I lost my wallet on the Metro between Barajas and the hotel. The staff was understanding and helpful. They provided the toll-free numbers for VISA and MasterCard, and they let me stay even though I did not get a replacement credit card until the last day. So what did I not like? The room did not have a refrigerator or a minibar. The first few days, I noticed a slightly soapy smell from the sheets and also in the hallways. I don't know if they started rinsing better, or if my nose got desensitized, but I did not notice the smell after a couple days. The one thing I really did not like was the tiny shower. The inside was only about two feet square (60cm x 60cm), and there was no soap dish or any place to put the soap, shampoo, etc. The plumbing was mounted on the center of the wall, and protruded about 6 inches (15cm) into the shower, encroaching into the precious space. I found it impossible to move around without accidentally hitting the valve and either shutting off the water or changing its temperature; it would have been much better if they had installed the plumbing and controls in the corner, or made the space in the shower a little larger.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good price, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: fco
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 March days in cool but sunny Madrid. Situated bang in the centre so people watching from the small balcony is excellent. Room was basic but recently done out, very clean and a good sized modern bathroom with shower over bath. No problem catching airport bus for Euro 1 pp to Avenida Americas and then a taxi/bus etc to hotel. Easy for taxi early morning to airport direct arranged by hotel for around Euro 30. Restaurant/bar attached on ground floor great for simple or big breakfast and a nibble/drink before setting off or coming back in the evening - prices reasonable. All the staff very polite with greater or lesser degrees of English and a smile always greeted a smile. Free internet in lobby for 15 minutes but if no one around for longer. Small charge for room safe. Would definitely stay again if you want ease of location for sites and shopping and at a good no nonsense price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bustling Location with Polite Staff”
Reviews.Author: chinglish
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in May 2007. The hotel is in a fantastic location, easy to get to by cab from the airport (about 34 euros in 2007)and easy to depart from, we took a cab to train station (10 euros). We walked everywhere from our hotel, to the museums (Reina Sofia, Prado, Real Jardin) to the tapas bars and San Gines Chocolateria. Since it is in central bustling location, definitely be prepared for some noise. We got a room with a balcony view. I love people-watching and absorbing the city's culture. We saw a small parade of some sports fans run by. Just love that kind of spontaneous spirit. Definitely not a quiet, serene area - so for those light sleepers, I would recommend a room away from the street. We didn't mind, as we were out late trying all the wonderful tapas bars and we stumbled home late at night and crashed into deep sleep. I was pleasantly surprised by the nice washroom and tub/toilet - much more modern than I expected, compared to the design of the hallway interiors and tiny elevator. The room interior was clean. I was tempted to just put average, since the interiors were ok and not brand new. But the central location, the balcony view and polite staff nudged to above average - it was a nice first 2 days for our two week trip in Spain/Portugal. The staff were very polite with our luggage and everytime we came in and out of the hotel. We asked the counter staff to help us book a restaurant reservation for us since we can't speak Spanish and they helped us no problem. There is a small fee for using their phone though.

Reviews.Title: “great experience!”
Reviews.Author: em0514
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Hotel Europa. It was in a great location, only a 10-15 minute walk to most major sites in Madrid. The room had a safe (a few euros per day) and the lobby had free use of a computer with internet access. The cafe was also nice for a quick breakfast or coffee! Would definitly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - kinda iffy on Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Maidstone7
Reviews.Content: My sisters and I have just returned from our European Vacation and this was our last stop. We were sooooooo happy to see a Bathtub!!! We took showers at all of our Italy hotels and so a bath was a wonderful surprise! The hotel itself is in a great location. Right by the metro stop. In a very busy area and walking to restaurants were not a problem. Staff were friendly and accomodating. They have a little cafeteria/restaurant on the ground floor. Great balcony that overlooked the Puerta del Sol. This really was a lovely hotel and a great end to our vacation. Now for Madrid...ugh. There were soooooo many people there. Tourists, locals, pickpocketers. Yes - we ran into a group of pickpocketers on the subway from the Airport to our hotel. It was a bit of a nasty situation - but came out of it fine. You need to be ALERT when you are on vacation and read all of the cautions to any big city! We did all of that and that's why we came out fine with a story to tell! There is a lot to see in Madrid - and this is a great hotel that is really centrally located to all sites.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but one BIG problem”
Reviews.Author: Avidtraveller21
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights in a double room at the Hotel Europa. The location is fantastic, and the room itself in terms of size and decor was fine. HOWEVER... for the entire duration of our stay, we were forced to endure a pungent smell coming from the drains in our ensuite bathroom. On our second night, the stench resulted in one of the worst nights sleep we have ever had in a hotel. We raised the issue with management and asked to be moved to another room, but they claimed they were fully booked and this would be impossible. At check-out, given the problem could not be fixed and we could not be moved, we requested that the problem be reflected in our room rate via a discount. We were told this was not possible as the manager was not available but that we could follow up via email during the week. Some 2 weeks and multiple emails later, management refused to offer us any kind of discount on the amount we paid for our room, instead offering a discount on our next stay, which is completely pointless as this was a one-off trip to Madrid. We will not be recommending this hotel to anyone nor staying there again ourselves - not because of the problem we endured with the bathroom, but management's attitude and response which was disappointing and unsatisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: Doc-US-08
Reviews.Content: We had just one night in Madrid, and I am glad we spent it at the Europa. It is clean, roomy, comfortable, quiet and convenient to the metro and nightlife. I rate it excellent. Enough said.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable well-placed hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Osric7
Reviews.Content: I am not used to hotel stays and found the experience a good one.The staff are very professional,polite,and smart.So are the facilities.I found the room to be the most plush we stayed in this holiday (out of 4 hotels) and enjoyed the breakfast,snacks and evening meal from the restaurant.Our waiter was a character. The hotel is well placed,close to the square and the bear statue,where street musicians played,and to shops and more bars. You get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sherry24
Reviews.Content: An excellent 2 night stay in this hotel. Great location, staff helpful and friendly. Booked through their website. Reccommended

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel...great price!”
Reviews.Author: MichiganJeanne
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised that the reviews I read about this property were indeed correct!! The location is unbeatable. The rate was amazing. The room was beautifully, if simply, furnished. I was traveling alone visiting my daughter and this hotel was just perfect! I speak no Spanish, so that was a bit intimidating. I would highly recommend the Hotel Europa to everyone! It was a fantastic experience all around!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place to stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: GeekyGadgetGal
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice (January 2006 and March 2001) and really enjoy the accommodations. It was under renovation when I was there last, so I can only imagine it looks fabulous today. It is in the heart of Puerta Del Sol close to the metro and El Corte Ingles. If you're exploring the city, it is an excellent hotel to be based out of. I also heartily recommend the restaurant attached to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Way to go, Hotel Europa!”
Reviews.Author: outtraveling
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our 1 week Portugal/Spain trip. We stayed 3 nights at Hotel Europa, , # 404 (a triple room). Despite the unimpressive pictures on the website, I went ahead and booked this hotel. It exceeded my expectation and more. We got off from Callao station rather than Sol, so it was a bit of walk for us to get to the hotel, but it is actually only a few steps away from Sol station, so make sure you get off from Sol. Our room was very clean with wooden floor, beds made daily. Our room had 2 windows that opened to 2 balconies overseeing Calle de Carmen, where the city center is. Street noise was not an issue, however, there were loud door closing from inconsiderate neighbors. Right next to the hotel, there is a Tapas bar, the bartenders are hospitable. They did not treat us like tourist. My brother had the snails and I had a small beer. If you like arroz dishes, you should definitely try Restaurante La Barraca (Calle Reina, 29) or Restaurante de Reina (calle Reina,39), they are both on Calle de la Reina, 1 street over from and parallel to Gran Via. Try paella negro con gamgas, appetizers, sangria... I highly recommend them. Our bills came out to be less than 100 euros for 3 people for both places, it was with either wine or sangria, appetizers, soups, try Castilan Soup at La Barraca. Anyway, hotel Europa is central to everything you'd want to do in Madrid, including sight seeing, food, shopping..., everything is within walking distance in europe already but hotel eurorpa just makes everything that much more convenient and enjoyable.
