El Cote Inglesia (major department store) is 1 block over, Plaza Mayor only a few blocks away... you get the picture. Oh, we were able to see the bear statue from our balcony. If you need a taxi at an odd hour, have the hotel clerk call one for you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: yankancuch
Reviews.Content: Hotel Europa is wonderfully located just off the Plaza del Sol, and has clean, roomy, modern rooms in an atmospheric historic building (birthsite of artist Juan Gris). The "superior" rooms are fantastic, many with great views and a small balcony overlooking the Plaza. If you're very sensitive to noise, street noise may be an issue, since the Plaza is a vibrant, active area late into the night. But the windows have good seals, so I don't think it's a problem for most. (We had a 6 piece street band playing dixieland jazz right next to our window, but with the windows closed it didn't bother us.) Amenities are pretty standard, nothing special. Wifi is only available in the lobby, but you can connect for free by cable from the rooms. Front desk is helpful and friendly. Very rasonable rates for such a well kept, comfortable hotel with contemporary and attractive furnishings and decor, yet a building and atmosphere with some character and a sense of history. And very nice balance of old and new.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Silv78
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great for a number of reasons. First, it has the best location in my opinion, right off the Puerto del Sol. It's walking distance to all attractions and shopping which was a plus. The hotel staff was really helpful as well. The rooms were very clean and adequate. Overall, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best of the Best”
Reviews.Author: pubprisoner
Reviews.Content: Hotel Europa was the best stay of our two week trip through Spain and Portugal. I would give it 4+ stars. Great location, friendly staff, nice bar/restaurant and outstanding accomodations. We were on the second floor facing the plaza. Open the doors to see all the action. Close the doors for peace and quiet. We looked at a few other places nearby, including Hotel Plaza Mayor, BW Carlos V, and Petit Palace, and I would definately choose Europa. Very classy place.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good price, in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Leki
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great central location within walking distance to many of the tourist attractions. The only disappointment my husband and I had was we had requested a double bed and ended up with 2 twins. We just pushed them together and it was really no big deal. The bathroom and room were fairly large. Our balcony overlooked the street. One word of warning I will give you is it is LOUD so if you are a light sleeper be sure to bring ear plugs. We had been warned on trip advisor of this so we did bring the ear plugs and I did use them. Be sure to try La Mallorquina, a pastry and coffee bar in Purta del Sol accross the square from the hotel with the best pastries you will ever eat! It rained most of the time we were there which was a bummer but we still got to do most everything we wanted. We really enjoyed Madrid. If you do not know Spanish, please consider taking a crash course before visiting. Unlike other European countries we have visited, English is not spoken or learned in school here. I don't want to sound like the "ugly American" that expects them to speak English, I am just saying that it made it very difficult at times to communicate. We had a little book that we bought at home before we left that had some key phrases and words but it was not enough! Plus, the Spanish I do know is nothing like they speak here. Go ahead and book this hotel if you are looking for a good value in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but......”
Reviews.Author: Bill99
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nites and as noted in several reviews its location is excellant and rooms and hallways are clean. Our first 3 nites were in a good size double room on inner courtyard . However, after a few days to Sevilla upon return we were switched to another double room on the inner courtyard that was much smaller than the other and had large crack in the wall; that was not the problem however. A noise from an adjacent building, akin to a howling animal, (we think from the rooftop HVAC unit) every 3-5 minutes thru the nite and day and echoed loudly within the courtyard rooms. We complained to the front desk who acknowledged the problem but could nothing about it. Whether this was an isolated instance I don't know, but certainly was an issue for us and others who complained. Perhaps a rate reduction or a comp at the restaraunt would have been a nice accomodation to us. Barring this incident, the hotel is a fine stay for the money. We paid 80 euro.

Reviews.Title: “Very decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yiqi
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is quite unbeatable, especially if you are going to Madrid for shopping. The staff were pretty helpful with out enquiries when we had a problem with our train from madrid to barcelona. The room was clean and of a decent size. Good choice for a stay in madrid

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Value in Madrid!”
Reviews.Author: A_Fellow_Traveler
Reviews.Content: I had originally booked the Plaza Mayor for 3 nights, because it was higher on Trip Advisor's list than this place. When we decided to add one more night, however, Plaza Mayor was already booked.That is how we wound up at Hotel Europa. I paid 80 euros for each place (for a double), but that price included tax at the Europa. The Europa also provided free internet access in the lobby. Finally, the Europa had a decent, affordable restaurant right off the lobby. That was safe and convenient for people who had just arrived in town and were tired. Also, the rooms were larger than I expected at this rate in a European Capital. Location is on a pedestrian street, which is nice and VERY close to the Plaza de Sol. That is a very central metro stop. The metro is, by the way, very clean/safe and easy to figure out. So, if I come again, I will definitely return here and skip the Plaza Mayor--though both are clean and represent good values. The Europa is just a few notches ahead with regard to decor and space.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Europa is Great!”
Reviews.Author: Jels
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Europa is centrally located at Plaza del Sol, right off the Metro stop Sol. The staff is attentive and very helpful, and for such a great location, I was pleasantly surprised of the reasonableness of rates. Compared to other European hotel rooms, my rooms at the beginning and end of my trip to Spain were large. The first few nights, I was placed right on the plaza side, which gave me great views. It can get pretty noisy, though. My second stay, I was placed in one of their what seemed to be very newly refurbished rooms (very quiet, not on the street, but no views). Attached restaurant is convenient. The hotel is near El Cortez Ingles, which is a huge department store in Spain. In the basement, there is a full supermarket, so you can stock up on cheap snacks and bottled water before you go walking around. I highly recommend Hotel Europa!

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied with Hotel Europa”
Reviews.Author: debi_zyx
Reviews.Content: We had a really hard time booking this hotel, since the email on their site didn't seem to be working. In the end, it took a few phone calls, but was definitely worth the effort. We stayed for 3 nights in the beginning of July, with a double and triple room (with children of 15, 13 and 6), and the hotel exceeded our expectations. This was the first place we stayed during our 2-week long holiday in Spain, and it was our first visit to Madrid. The position is fantastic - just on the Puerto del Sol, with throngs of people at all times. The double-glazed windows did an excellent job of keeping the noise out, and as others have said, when we wanted to be part of the scenery, they opened up so that we had a fabulous view of the square. While we were there, there was a lot of building going on, so the triple room had a view directly into the building works, but since we were out most of the day, it didn't really matter. The rooms were nice sized, in fact the triple was really big, and they were very clean. Free wireless internet in the lobby was very welcome, Renting a network cable for my laptop cost 1 Euro per day, which is fine, considering that there was free wired internet in the rooms. We were rather irritated about the additional cost of 2 Euro per day for using the in-room safe. We would have liked a mini-bar in the room, as we had some things that needed refrigeration, but were given the use of a refrigerator in the left-luggage room, which was ok. The staff were very helpful. All in all, we would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel of the trip”
Reviews.Author: TexasGal19
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel 4 nights in mid-Sept. In a word - this hotel was perfect! The rooms are immaculate, updated, and very comfortable - an unbelievable value. The location is ideal. We walked everywhere with ease and took the metro when needed, which was right outside of the hotel's front door. Hotel staff was friendly and the computer available for internet access in the lobby was a nice extra. We arrived before noon and were able to check-in to our room immediately. We were given a room with a small terrace overlooking the bustling Puerta del Sol - the exact center of Madrid. Besides being a very popular hangout, Puerta del Sol has some construction going on, so I had some initial concerns that the room might be noisy. Luckily, the room has soundproof windows that blocked about 95% of the noise from outside - I was really amazed and very pleased - and we had no problems whatsoever with noise. This hotel turned out to be our favorite during our 17 day trip to Spain. We wouldn't consider staying anywhere else when we return to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “A Terrific Value!”
Reviews.Author: Multivalent
Reviews.Content: We booked a double and triple for three nights and couldn't have been more pleased with the facility, staff, and location. The double-paned windows to the balconey keep the commotion of Puerta del Sol out when you want it, but swing them open every once in awhile and drink in the atmosphere of this lovely city.

Reviews.Title: “excellent deal”
Reviews.Author: TexasCorkie
Reviews.Content: For Madrid, this was a great location, just off Puerta del Sol, Metro stop Sol, and price - $80euro/double. They had a great cafeteria. Excellent service, clean room, good AC, shower, hair dryer, comfortable, quiet. www.hoteleuropa. They speak English and work hard to please.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: am6585
Reviews.Content: My sister, mother and I stayed at the Hotel Europa for 3 nights (ok only 2, but more about that later). It was beautiful, less than a minute walk to two metro stations, right on el Puerta del Sol, the heart of Madrid. The room was clean and large, especially compared to others we have experienced in European hotels. Interesting note: you have to leave your key card in the holder by the door or the electronic systems (lights, AC) will power down after a few minutes. The hotel restaurant is nice, not cheap, but reasonably priced. The food is good, the waiters don't speak a lot of english, but you can get by. It's a great place to people watch, as you are almost on el Puerta del Sol, lots of people are always walking by. The staff is very friendly, they all speak some english, one gentleman in particular speaks perfect english as well as perfect spanish. There is free internet access in the lobby, they ask that you limit your time to 15 minutes per room. The only problem we had with our entire trip was the fiasco of getting to the airport Friday morning. We were all set to take the shuttle to the airport, until we realized it was E20 per person and they only accepted cash, which we did not have enough of as our trip was almost over. Our flight left at 7:15, and the Madrid metro doesn't begin daily service until 6:00. We ended up staying the night in the airport. So my advice to someone about leaving Madrid is to book a flight no earlier than late morning, unless you want to spend the money on a shuttle or taxi, or have someone who can personally drive you to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Bright spot in a sea of mud”
Reviews.Author: Hueytown
Reviews.Content: We happened to be staying in Madrid for the two days of flooding in May 2007. The hotel was bright and clean, even if they streets were flooded halfway to the knees. We barely left the hotel, and ate 3 out of 4 meals in the city at the hotel's cafe (INside). I highly recommend the chocolate w/churros and the flan. The room was unusually large for a European hotel, same for the bathroom. It has been maintained with loving care and it shows. There are 2 elevators. This hotel is conveniently located to bus and metro stops. It is easy to find, just off Plaza del Sol and behind the statue of the bear. HUGE dept store, Corte Ingles, is at the end of the block, and it is uphill and has 5 or 6 above ground floors, good to know in a flood. Free internet in lobby, however, there was always a line waiting to use it. No prob just to check email, but if you need time to work, bring a laptop.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel compared to the price”
Reviews.Author: murakami
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in the heart of the old center of Madrid just beside Puerta Del Sol. Compared to price you get a comfortable stay. The hotel has just been renovated just as the staff is friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: readytoretirecalgary
Reviews.Content: I would go back here and highly recommend it to others. It is in a great location, the rooms are good, good value for the money, friendly front desk staff, a restaurant and bar and free internet (when you can get on it). We stayed at another hotel on our return to Madrid, and were we ever sorry!! I'd have taken the Europa in a flash, but it was booked. Won't make that mistake again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Wrldtrvlr28112
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for three nights with my mother and sister, and it was excellent! The staff were very courteous and helpful. Our room was large, allowing three women with a lot of luggage to move about freely. The room was also very clean, comfortable, and quiet. We had no problems whatsoever in staying here. I would definitely stay in this hotel again in future trips to Madrid rather than risk getting an unsatisfactory room in a cheaper hotel.

Reviews.Title: “loved it, renewed!!!”
Reviews.Author: lunadream
Reviews.Content: We stayed there march 18-20, 2007. Tremedous service, clean rooms, very kind people, hablan ingles y espanol, nearby metro stops, tour buses, shops, food, nightlife, etc. For 75-100 euros, can't beat price and convenience!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Location Can't Be Beat”
Reviews.Author: mrjlal
Reviews.Content: We stayed over the weekend and we extremely pleased with the condition of the hotel, which looks recently remodeled, the cleanliness, and the location, which is just perfect. And we were very happy with the standard website prices we paid. There were six of us -- 2 adults and 2 kids in a very nice quad, and 2 adults in the superior double. I think the bed in the superior double is king size while the regular sized doubles had a smaller bed. Internet in the room (wired) was free. Lots of convenient shopping to suit all tastes in the immediate area, walking distance to both the Palace as well as the Prado in opposite directions. We would be hard pressed to stay anywhere else on a return visit. No shuttle service from the airport but they called a service for us back to the airport. We had an excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great for shopping; dislike guest policy”
Reviews.Author: SoutheastAsiaSusan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Europa hotel for six nights between 22 February through 3 March. The hotel is located right on the popular Puerta Del Sol and just across from Cortes, a large department store with a supermarket at the basement. So getting food/ drinks is not a problem, particularly since there is also a coffee shop next to the hotel. It is worth mentioning that if you're unfamiliar with the area, you might have a little bit of trouble finding the hotel after being dropped off by the cab driver (who's most likely not able to converse in English) for a short walk. Please note that the taxi can NOT stop right in front of the hotel so a little bit of walking is required. I would suggest that you bring a suitcase that have wheels. If you like shopping and crowd watching, this is definitely the hotel for you - it is also a short walk to Grand Via, where there are plenty of shops like Zara as well as some theaters. However, if you require peace and quiet, this is not the hotel for you, as it could get pretty loud particularly on Friday and Saturday nights with the noise continuing till dawn. I was disturbed a little and we stayed on the third floor. We also didn't like the fact that we were charged 2 euros per day for the use of the safe deposit box. But the biggest minus for this hotel is its guest policy, which does not allow for any guest at any time to come up to your room. In fact, we had to leave our room keys at the reception each and every time we leave the hotel. We had a couple of friends who were staying in another hotel at Grand Via come over as they wanted to compare the rooms. After explaining the situation, our friends were allowed up to see our room, but after just a couple minutes, the front desk rang and demanded that our guests leave the room. Overall it was an ok experience, and we would stay there again simply because of the convenient location and the reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend Hotel Europa”
Reviews.Author: YoWA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked 2 different stays at Hotel Europa - in between a trip to the Canary Islands. Very efficient booking over the internet and quick confirmation. We took the #200 bus from the Airport and then caught a cab to the hotel, which is located in a pedestrian only zone so, no vehicle traffic noise heard from our room. Large double room and bath. Our second stay we were in another room on the 4th floor and had a sulphury smell coming from the water in the bathroom - we kept the fan on to cut down on the smell. Great location to see Puerta Del Sol by foot. The cafeteria - part of the hotel - is recommended - great cafe con leches! The staff at the hotel kept our skiis and extra gear for us while we were at the Canary Islands. When we checked back in our bags were waiting for us in the room. To get back to the airport we arranged a shuttle pick up in the morning from the hotel for 10 Euro each - very worthwhile!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!!!”
Reviews.Author: tlemus
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 days, and we couldn't have been happier about our choice. It's in the heart of Madrid, with a subway entrance right in front of the hotel, a cafe right besides the lobby with excellent prices, and a view to the Puerta del Sol. The hotel was very clean, and the noise was not an issue, although if you are a light sleeper, choose an inside view room. I have a very light sleep, and this wasn't an issue since we came back at night exhausted from the walking, sightseeing and all the fun we had. I can't wait to come back,and I will definitely stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Central location couldn't be better, yet quiet and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Pompeyperson
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night in early October. We didn't have a reservation and called in after catching the Metro from the airport. We would have stayed 2 or 3 nights but the hotel was fully booked. The hotel's central location in the Puerta del Sol right beside the statue of Madid's emblem (the bear and the strawberry tree) couldn't have been better. The room was spacious, cool and comfortable - an oasis from the hustle and bustle of Madrid but right in the centre of things, if you wanted to go out on the town, which we did. Our room overlooked the Puerta del Sol but, with the double-glazed window closed, we weren't aware of excessive noise from the street and slept soundly. The reception staff were friendly, helpful and spoke good English - a pity really, because I wanted to practise my Spanish! Oh! and the price was very reasonable too, especially as we didn't have a reservation. The only downside to staying in this hotel was that renovation works were taking place in the lobby area. Also, the reception/lobby area was small and cramped - but anyway, you don't spend much time there, so it didn't matter. We would definitely stay there again but would pre-book to be sure of a room for the duration of our stay. Portsmouth, England

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: bikersusan
Reviews.Content: Wonderful small hotel in the heart of Madrid. Close to a Metro stop. My room had been updated, especially the bathroom. I had a very small balcony with French Doors that overlooked a very noisey walkway. But you could shut the French Doors and have peace and quite. This is not the Ritz, but if your looking for a small hotel in the heart of things, this is the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but request a quiet room”
Reviews.Author: Green_Backpack
Reviews.Content: The rooms are quite spacious and very clean. The same can be said about the bathrooms. The adjacent cafeteria provides early morning and/or late night dining options for the jet-lagged traveler at a good price. The churros con chocolate hit the spot! The location is very appealing as well for anyone hoping to visit the sites Madrid has to offer. The nearest metro stop is just a short walk away. Upon arrival I was given a single room with a bathroom on the second floor facing the front of the building. At the time of my check-in I noticed some construction taking place in the hotel. Once in my room the noise from the construction immediately led me downstairs to request another room away from the noise which the hotel staff were more than willing to do for me. I was given a room in the rear of the building well out of ear shot of the construction. Keep that in mind if you plan on staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean & big Bathroom”
Reviews.Author: VaerSaaGod
Reviews.Content: I stayed in 4 other hotels in Spain during my trip and the room was one of the smaller ones but the bathroom was the best at Hotel Europa. I always like to take a nice hot shower in a spacious & comfortable bathroom, which I got at this hotel. It's located in the center-center of the city, very convenient for sightseeing and getting on the Metro. The area around the hotel is always full of people (except for early in the morning) and you can get the feel of Madrid. I knew from (thanks to) other people's review that the hotel was undergoing renovation. I didn't ask for it when I made reservations directly with the hotel but we did get one of the renovated rooms so it was very nice and clean with a tiny balcony. The noise from the outside didn't bother us but sometimes we heard a kind of gurgle noise probably from the other rooms (maybe someone flushing the toilet or using the shower, I'm not sure). I was a bit surprised when I first heard the noise but it was just once in a while and it didn't bother us much. The lobby was going through some construction but we didn't hear anything from our room although our room was just 1 floor above. We didn't have any trouble with the airconditioning, probably because we stayed towards the end of October. Not too cold nor hot, so we didn't have to bother with it. Breakfast was not included but there's a cafe next door. The price ranged from 2.40 (coffee & toast) to 10.00 euros depending on how much you want to eat! Other things I liked and that was helpful about the hotel was that all 3 people I met at the reception spoke English and there's a shuttle service to the airport (I believe several euros cheaper than taking a cab). In some of the websites I saw the hotel is rated 1 star but I found in one of the guidebooks I bought it is rated 3 stars. I don't know how they rate hotels and which is true but if you consider the location, price, cleanliness and comfort of the room and bathroom, I think it's worth staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean and In a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bustervi
Reviews.Content: We asked for room that was quiet considering that there is construction at the Puerta del Sol. We had a room that faced a courtyards and was very quiet...perfect for light sleepers. There is construction in the lobby of the hotel, but the rooms are spotless and the newly renovated bathroom is a big plus. We were close to everything, shopping, food, and the metro. All the museums can be reached by metro within 10 minutes or less.

Reviews.Title: “No Worries at The Europa”
Reviews.Author: TrampledUnderfoot
Reviews.Content: Twelve of us stayed at The Europa over the last weekend in September and the verdict was unanimous - a great hotel right in the centre of Madrid and we had no complaints (except one or two of us would have liked a kettle in the room!... but for thirty quid each a night it was great value). Email booking direct with the hotel was fast and efficient. As mentioned by other reviews the Plaza del Sol is under construction and the hotel lobby is being done up but this was not a problem and didn’t affect our stay at all. We only spent about five minutes in the lobby checking in and out. All our rooms were spotless, spacious, bright and modern, had air conditioning and very effective double glazing which completely blocked out the noise (and it was very noisy in the square below!). Rooms on the outside had a small balcony. The staff were helpful and efficient and took care of the check-in, shuttle bus and bag storage etc without fuss. The hotel is in walking distance of Plaza Mayor and the Royal Palace. The Prado and the Retiro park are a slightly further walk or four stops from the nearby Metro for a euro. (The Retiro is definitely worth a visit on a sunny Sunday afternoon). There are lots of bars, restaurants and shops close by. The Europa Restaurant and bar next door is in a pedestrian area, has chairs and tables outside and is a good meeting point. So, if you want a great room for fantastic value right in the middle of town I would definitely recommend this hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: teris
Reviews.Content: We were in Madrid for only 2 nights before returning to the US so we wanted a central location and we got it! When the cab dropped us at the hotel we were really worried - grafitti all over plywood borded windows! The lobby was being remodeled and smelled like wet sheetrock. However we were pleasantly surprised when we opened the door to our room. It was huge and the bathroom had been remodeled and was also very large and all marble. For 105 euros for a triple we found it to be far superior to any of the other hotels we had stayed at during the previous two weeks in Spain & Portugal. We found the staff to be helpful and courteous. They even arranged for a cab to pick up our daughter at 3:00 am for her very early morning flight. We would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “War Zone”
Reviews.Author: johnd2
Reviews.Content: To say the hotel looks like a war zone is a little understatement. To say the staff is unhelpful is also an understatement. To say they could care less about the room tempertature ( two of the three rooms were never below 30), making airline confirmations, getting a shuttle to the airport would be right-on. We stayed in six hotels in Spain and Portugal in the same price range and this by far was the worst experience. This hotel should be avoided at all costs. Perhaps it will be better by 2008 !

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms - Good Value”
Reviews.Author: jessi12
Reviews.Content: We were a little worried when we arrived and saw the current state of the lobby but once you get past the remodeling work being done on the entrance the rooms were in excellent shape and appeared to have been redone recently. The location of the hotel is great with tons of sites and restaurants within easy walking distance. Given the hotels central location we were pleasantly surprised at how quiet the room was, but we are not light sleepers. The hotel offered limited services but it was what we expected for the price. All in all we found the rooms to be excellent for the price and the location great. If you are looking for a luxurious lobby and five star amenities you should look elsewhere, but if you want a great location with a clean and comfortable room we would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Look beyond the lobby for a great value and room”
Reviews.Author: pgolden
Reviews.Content: After fighting mid-day Madrid traffic, we arrived at the hotel and thought we had made a horrible mistake. Taped up signs directed us to the entrance to the hotel and the lobby looked more like a flop-house entrance. I'm not even sure it has a front door. As I dropped my wife and son off to find parking I had a horrible feeling that we were going to have to cancel our reservation and hoof it to find another place. I told my wife to check out the room while I parked. As I walked back to the hotel my wife and son were smillingly calling to me from a balcony on the third floor telling me the room was perfect - which it was when I got to it. The hotel is definitely undergoing renovations, but they seemed to have completed the rooms and are just working on the lobby, entrance and adjacent restaurant. These are the most spacious rooms we've had on our trip. Comfortable beds, large, clean baths with showers, satellite TV, and Internet (bring your own network cable to plug in). You are steps from the Puerta del Sol and all the major shopping stores in Madrid. Halfway between the Prado and the Royal Palace, this is a perfect location for enjoying Madrid on foot. We were not told to expect breakfast in the 120 euro price, so I didn't notice the lack of the restaurant as others said. I didn't even realize the restaurant was mentioned highly in other travel guides until we were here. There is no shortage of restaurants of all kinds within easy walking distance. Even my first glimpse of a European Dunkin' Donuts! The only drawback I'd note is that the excellent map on their website can be a bit misleading. Directions are accurate, but the side streets they indicate to the hotel are pedestrian roads. You can drive down them to deliver passengers and luggage without any problem from the locals (though you do get funny looks from the other tourists!) I highly recommend this hotel for the rooms and quiet atmosphere in a bustling part of Madrid. If you judge a hotel by the lobby this may not be the place for you, but for all the rest it's great. Stay here for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Misleading Advertising”
Reviews.Author: tas10000
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby is completely torn up, and the restaurant (highly acclaimed in travel guides and on the website) is under construction -- aka CLOSED. No food available through any means, even though there is a full menu in the room. The entrance to the hotel looks like a war zone. They make no mention of this construction project in their communication. There was construction noise quite regularly during each day. On the plus side -- We requested a balcony and received a great one -- on the first floor overlooking the main street. If you get such a room, it will make up for almost everything. The rooms are nicely renovated and clean. The best feature aside from the perfect location was the soundproof balcony shutter system. The walking crowd can be very loud and exciting. It's great to be able to shut it out and sleep when you need to. We found the staff to be great once you get acquainted after a couple days. And they did a great job getting our luggage to the taxi on the square... I can tell that when the hotel's back to normal, the restaurant open and the lobby repaired, it's probably the best hotel in town. Ask for a good balcony location...

Reviews.Title: “OK, but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: Ullas
Reviews.Content: Perfect location. The staff did no tell us, although we checked, there were no breakfast-room available because of reconstructions. Generally quite unpleasant/unhelpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant location, great value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellant location. The staff are not overly friendly - but I didn't go to Madrid to visit them. The hotel is exactly what you want on a weekend away to Madrid. The room is big, very clean, laminate floors which were also very clean. It's a bit of a rabbit warren to get to the room - but the hallways etc are also well kept. Our room had two large windows, both over looking the street - we enjoyed watching all the street sellers cautiously selling their pirate dvds etc... while also watching for the police - they had an impressive getaway system. The hotel is right on PLaza del Sol, and very near to PLaza Mayor, the area is very safe and great for going out at night. As the area is buzzing at night there is a lot of street noise- mainly people chatting, but the rooms are insulated enough to exclude most noise. It's also right beside the subway station. Some people may be disappointed with the entrance lobby - it is a tad shabby compared to the rooms. But don't judge a book by it's cover, the rooms are recently renovated and it's nice to see that the money was spent on the rooms rather than the lobby where you don't spend any time. I travelled with my fiance - we were both delighted with it and would definitely stay here on a return trip to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Europa a great choci in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: jaj_travel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Europa for 3 nights at the beginning of February. Excellent location right in the centre of Madrid, very convenient for shops, bars, restaurants. The rooms were very good, amazing value for money having recently been renovated. There was still some construction in progress so the lobby and stairway were messy. This is a bit off putting when you first enter the hotel. There was some building noise during the day but it didn't cause us a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Choice in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Dory
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our daughter and son-in-law spent 3 nights at the Europa on the fourth floor. The location is excellent and staff went out of their way to be helpful. Our rooms were spotless and comfortable. The only drawback is the hotel is still undergoing renovations so the common areas are a bit of a mess. That was not a problem for us, but I would suggest a double superior on the fourth floor to avoid some of the construction noise. The sound proofing French doors to the tiny balcony did an amazing job of blocking out street noise. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: agaurav
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Europa in Puerta del Sol area of Madrid, Spain for 2 night in Feb 2006. It was a good deal at 80 euros per night for a very clean room and a great bathroom. The hotel is undergoing some redesign and construction so the hallways etc aren't that great but our room had been renovated etc so was good. The bedsheet was bad though (torn at 2 places). The hotel is centrally located and a stone's throw from all the activity. We enjoyed it a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: carrilou
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3nights at the end of our trip. We picked this hotel from one of our guide books and very happy we did. The hotel is centrally located right in the heart of Puerta del Sol center. From there you can walk, take a bus or train to any part of Madrid. This area is filled with plently of sights, shops and restaurants (Tapas was great in this city). During our stay the hotel was rehabbing the building and did not effect our stay at all. We stayed in the premuim deluxe room (95.00 euro's) and our balcony faced the city centre, I was initially worried that we would hear the traffic on the busy streets, this was not a problem the room was sound proofed so well we didn't hear a thing. The staff was friendly and wanted to assist you with any needs. There was a restaurant linked to the hotel, which was nice for breakfast and after dinner drinks. We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: stargazer1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Europa on two separate occasions last October and all I can say is, "Wow!" Its location is perfect; the rooms are comfortable and super clean; and the staff is simply fantastic. It is undergoing some remodeling, but that did not interfere with the good-night sleep I had on both occasions. I could not hear the outside noise either. On the last night I was there, I had dinner at the hotel's restaurant. The waiters were courteous and helpful when asked for suggestions, the service impeccable, the dinner simply great. I now know this is the place to stay whenever I'm in Madrid.
